# University of Vavuniya and Ministry of Science and Technology Partner to Foster Sustainable Food Innovation

November 3, 2025

The Ministry of Science and Technology and the University Business Linkage Cell of the University of Vavuniya will sign a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on 11th November 2025 at 11:00 a.m. to establish collaboration in science, technology, and innovation aimed at advancing national development. This partnership particularly focuses on the establishment of an Incubation Centre for Sustainable Food Innovation in the Northern Province, Sri Lanka.

Through this initiative, both institutions aim to:

- Establish an Incubation Centre for Sustainable Food Innovation to support SMEs, foster innovation, and provide testing, certification, and commercialisation support.
- Promote training programmes, workshops, and knowledge-sharing platforms in sustainable food production.
- Provide access to food research, testing laboratories, and high-tech food processing facilities.
- Facilitate entrepreneurship, product development, testing, and certification to meet local and international food safety standards.
- Support regional development, food security, and export potential through innovation and technology transfer.

Mathivathany

Director/UBL

# Inauguration Ceremony of the Diploma in Early Childhood Education – Batch – II

September 7, 2025

The Inauguration Ceremony of the Diploma in Early Childhood Education – Batch II was held on

07th September 2025 at 10:00 AM at the Smart Lecture Hall, Faculty of Applied Science,

Pambaimadu, University of Vavuniya. The event marked a significant milestone in the university’s

ongoing commitment to the advancement of early childhood education. The ceremony was graced

by several distinguished guests, including Senior Prof. A. Atputharajah, Vice Chancellor of the

University of Vavuniya; Mr. S. A. Jude Leon, Director of the Centre for Distance and Continuing

Education (CDCE); Eng. M. Sooriasegaram, President of the Education Development Consortium;

Mr. Muralitharan, Assistant Director of Education (Pre-School), Vavuniya North; Dr. S.

Shanmugathasan, Academic Coordinator, and Ms. Y. Vithushana, Assistant Registrar of CDCE.

Their esteemed presence added great value to the occasion, which served as an inspiring beginning

for the new batch of students as they embark on their academic journey in the field of early

childhood education. The programme is designed to equip students with the knowledge, skills, and

practical experience necessary to become competent and compassionate early childhood educators.

# The 3rd Awarding Ceremony of the Centre for Distance and Continuing Education (CDCE), University of Vavuniya

September 28, 2025

The Centre for Distance and Continuing Education (CDCE) of the University of Vavuniya successfully held its 3rd Awarding Ceremony on 28th September 2025 at 2:00 PM at the Faculty of Technological Studies Lecture Hall, University of Vavuniya, Pampaimadu. The event marked the awarding of certificates to students from the following programs:

**(a) Advanced Certificate in Sports Coaching and Physical Education – Batch II**

**(b) Certificate in Entrepreneurship and Small Business Management – Batch II**

Although a total of 39 students from the Advanced Certificate program and 26 students from the Certificate in Entrepreneurship program were eligible to receive certificates, only 30 students were honored for their academic achievements and accomplishments.

Distinguished guests, including Senior Professor A, graced the ceremony.

Atputharajah, Vice Chancellor of the University of Vavuniya; Mr. Senthooran, Dean of the Faculty of Technological Studies; Dr. M. Kayanan, Dean of the Faculty of Applied Science; Mr. S. A. Jude Leon, the Director of the Centre for Distance and Continuing Education; Mr. N. Rajavisahan, Registrar of the University of Vavuniya; Mr. L. Ram Ramanan, Bursar of the University of Vavuniya; Ms. Mathivathany, Senior Lecturer of the Faculty of Business Studies; Mr. Sivanenthira, Senior Lecturer of the Faculty of Business Studies; Ms. J. Sivarubini, Assistant Bursar of the CDCE; and Ms. J. Vithushana, Assistant Registrar of the CDCE. This special occasion highlighted the university’s dedication to providing high-quality, accessible education and supporting the professional development of its students in the fields of sports coaching and physical education, entrepreneurship, and small business management.

# IT Centre Computer Laboratory Officially Re-Opened

November 25, 2025

**Venue:** IT Centre Laboratory

**Date:** 24.11.2025

**Time:** 10:30 AM

The University of Vavuniya proudly marked a major milestone with the reopening of the new IT Centre Computer Laboratory, a modern digital space designed to empower students with cutting-edge technology, research capability, and real-world IT skills.

Officially inaugurated by Senior Professor **A. Atputharajah**, Vice Chancellor of the University, the ceremony showcased our continued commitment to transforming the learning experience through advanced digital infrastructure. Outfitted with top-tier MSI computers, the lab offers an accelerated and more agile experience for programming, networking, data analysis, and contemporary IT applications. This enhancement marks a crucial advance in offering our students world-class educational resources.

# Discussion on Building Social Responsibility through Employee Volunteering

October 31, 2025

The Staff Development Center of the University of Vavuniya organized a discussion on “Building Social Responsibility through Employee Volunteering: Pathways for Academic Staff, Academic Support, Executive & Administrative Staff.” This workshop was scheduled to be held on 17th October 2025, from 11:00 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. at the Board Room, IT Centre, University of Vavuniya. The session was conducted by Mr. Balakumar Thangavelu, Director – CSR, India Head – Outreach, Employee Volunteering (CSR) \| Global Lead – ESG, and Ms. Vidhya Bhojan, Founder of Right Dots, a CSR consulting firm, who served as the resource persons, sharing their expertise with the staff.

The Discussion on “Building Social Responsibility through Employee Volunteering” successfully raised awareness among academic and administrative staff at the University of Vavuniya about the importance of integrating social responsibility into their professional roles. The resource persons explained the significance of employee volunteering and how university staff can actively contribute to community development. They shared examples of CSR programs and services that universities and alumni associations can implement. Additionally, they presented five main volunteering pathways for universities. The first is Curriculum-Linked Community Projects, where students and staff work on real-life community issues as part of their academic learning. The second is School and Infrastructure Support, which involves assisting schools with basic needs and facilities. The third pathway is Health and Nutrition Outreach, were staff support health awareness and nutrition programs for local communities. The fourth is Capacity Building and Teacher Training, focusing on enhancing the skills of school teachers. The fifth and final pathway is Immersive Exposure and Mentoring, where university members provide guidance and mentorship to students or youth through close interaction. Overall, the session helped participants understand how they can contribute meaningfully to society through volunteering and how such efforts can strengthen the university’s role in community development.

# Workshop on Cancer Awareness and Prevention Programme for University Staff: Promoting Early Detection and Healthy Living

October 29, 2025

The Well-Being Centre of the University of Vavuniya successfully conducted a workshop titled “ **_Cancer Awareness and Prevention Programme for University Staff: Promoting Early Detection and Healthy Living”_** on 29th October 2025 from 2.00pm – 4.00pm at Project Management Lecture Hall 2, Faculty of Business Studies. The programme was organized to raise awareness among university staff regarding cancer prevention, early detection, and the importance of adopting healthy lifestyle practices.

The session was delivered in Tamil by Dr. P. Anushanthini, Medical Officer in Charge for NCD, Vavuniya District. Dr. Anushanthini provided comprehensive information on common types of cancer, associated risk factors, early warning signs, and preventive strategies. The workshop emphasized the significance of early detection and timely medical consultation, alongside lifestyle measures such as balanced nutrition, regular physical activity, and stress management.

The workshop encouraged active participation, allowing staff to ask questions, share experiences, and clarify misconceptions regarding cancer and its prevention. Educational materials were distributed to reinforce key messages and support continued learning. A total of 22 staff members participated in the programme, including 15 academic staff and **7** non-academic staff, reflecting strong engagement from both teaching and administrative divisions of the university.

The Well-Being Centre plans to continue organizing similar health-related awareness programmes to further promote the physical and mental well-being of university staff. These initiatives are part of the Centre’s ongoing commitment to fostering a healthier, more informed, and proactive university community.

# Workshop on Healthy Life- The Way Forward

June 4, 2025

The **Well-Being Centre** successfully conducted a workshop titled **“Healthy Life – The Way Forward”** for the students and staff of the **University of Vavuniya** on **June 4, 2025,** from **10:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m.** This informative session featured expert contributions from **Dr. M. Aravinthan**, an Endocrinologist attached to the **Teaching Hospital, Jaffna**, as well as a panel of **Professors from the Jaffna Medical Association** and their medical team The workshop aimed to raise awareness and provide guidance on maintaining a healthy lifestyle, emphasizing preventive care and holistic well-being. The discussion included topics such as nutrition, physical activity, mental health, chronic disease prevention, and lifestyle management.The event was well-received by the participants, sparking engaging discussions and raising valuable questions about current health practices. It concluded with an interactive Q&A session, where attendees had the opportunity to clarify doubts and seek personalized advice from the experts. We thank all the resource persons and participants for making this workshop a meaningful and impactful event.

# Workshop on Empower Human Excellence Through Kiriya Yoga

June 25, 2025

A yoga awareness workshop was held on June 25, 2025, from 1.30 pm to 4.30 pm at SH4 Soosairathnam Hall, University of Vavuniya. The event was organized with the participation of Yogi Ram Sunthar, the resource person, along with his three assistants, two school students, the Vice-Chancellor, the Well-being Director, as well as staff and students of the university.  The workshop began with a welcome address by the Well-being Director, who spoke on the importance of yoga in maintaining mental and physical health, especially for students and academic professionals. Her speech set a meaningful tone for the session, highlighting yoga as a valuable tool for holistic well-being. Following the welcome, Yogi Ram Sunthar delivered the keynote speech. He discussed the importance of yoga and gave a motivational talk that emphasized the five major components of yoga: asana (postures), pranayama (breath control), dhyana (meditation), relaxation, and ethical living. His message was inspiring and encouraged everyone to include yoga in their daily routine. Next, one of the assistants of the resource person delivered a short  speech about yoga, further explaining its principles and benefits. This added depth to the session and reinforced the concepts introduced earlier. A practical yoga session followed, during which Yogi Ram Sunthar and his assistants guided the participants through various yoga exercises and techniques. The practical segment was engaging and gave the participants hands-on experience with different aspects of yoga practice. After the practice, the Vice-Chancellor addressed the gathering, appreciating the initiative and acknowledging the value of yoga in promoting a healthier campus environment. He encouraged all students and staff to regularly engage in yoga for their overall well-being. The session concluded with a vote of thanks delivered by the Well-being Director, who expressed her gratitude to the resource person, assistants, participants, and organizers. The workshop was a great success and left a positive impact on all who attended, promoting awareness and enthusiasm for yoga in the university community.

# Friendly Volleyball Match Against Indian Embassy Officials

September 19, 2025

A friendly volleyball match between the University of Vavuniya community and officials of the Indian Embassy was successfully held at the University of Vavuniya Volleyball Court on 19th September 2025. The event highlighted camaraderie, sportsmanship, and cross-cultural friendship.

In a spirited contest, the University of Vavuniya team showcased remarkable teamwork and skill, securing victory with an impressive 3–0 win over their opponents. The match drew much enthusiasm from players and spectators alike, reflecting the strong sporting culture within the university.

The occasion was honored by the presence of Mr. Sai Murali, Deputy Consul General of India, Senior Professor A. Atputharajah, Vice-Chancellor of the University of Vavuniya, and Mr. Rajavishagan, Registrar of the University. Officials from the Indian Consulate, university staff members, and many students also attended and cheered for the teams, adding to the lively atmosphere.

At the conclusion of the match, the winning team was awarded a championship trophy and certificates in recognition of their outstanding performance. The event not only celebrated athletic excellence but also strengthened the bonds of friendship and cooperation between the University of Vavuniya and the Indian Consulate

# University of Vavuniya Signs Landmark MoU with Lanka Electricity Company (LECO)

October 2, 2025

The University of Vavuniya, through its Faculty of Applied Science in collaboration with the Faculty of Technological Studies, entered into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Lanka Electricity Company (LECO) on 2nd October 2025 at 7:00 p.m. at the Monarch Imperial Hotel, Sri Jayawardenapura, Colombo.

This landmark partnership is aimed at strengthening research and development collaboration between academia and industry, with a special focus on addressing contemporary challenges in the electricity sector through digitalization and data-driven solutions. The collaboration is expected to advance innovation, support sustainable practices, and contribute significantly to national development.

Representing LECO at the ceremony were:

- Eng. Janaka Aluthge, Chairman
- Dr. (Eng.) P. S. N. De Silva, General Manager
- Eng. S. D. C. Gunawardana, Additional General Manager (Operations)
- Eng. M. D. Gamage, Additional General Manager (Engineering)
- Eng. Sanath Kumara, Deputy General Manager (Design & Development)
- Eng. Tharindu de Silva, Senior Project Manager (PSSREI Project)

Representing the University of Vavuniya were:

- Snr. Prof. A. Atputharajah, Vice Chancellor
- Dr. M. Kayanan, Dean, Faculty of Applied Science (FAS)
- Mr. V. Senthooran, Dean, Faculty of Technological Studies (FTS)
- Mr. N. Rajavisahan, Registrar
- Mr. L. Ram Ramanan, Bursar
- Mr. V. Vinoharan, Head, Department of ICT, FTS
- Mr. T. Jeyamugan, Coordinator, IT Degree Programme, FAS
- Dr. S. Kirushanth, Senior Lecturer (Grade I), FAS
- Mr. R. Sakuntharaj, Senior Lecturer (Grade I), FTS
- Dr. T. Kartheeswaran, Senior Lecturer, FAS and Director, IT Centre

Following the signing of the MoU, both parties held productive discussions on future collaborative activities, laying the foundation for innovative research, joint projects, and industry-driven solutions.

Speaking at the occasion, the Vice Chancellor emphasized that this MoU is one of the most remarkable milestones in the history of the University of Vavuniya, as it opens avenues for leveraging digital technologies and data analytics to address real-world electricity challenges. The partnership is expected to pave the way for smarter energy management, impactful innovations, and a stronger bridge between academia and industry for the betterment of the nation.

# International Conference on Applied Sciences – 2025

October 16, 2025

ICAS 2025, the first International Conference on Applied Sciences organized by the Faculty of Applied Science, University of Vavuniya, was a remarkable success. With 105 submissions from local and international authors, the conference maintained strong academic standards and accepted 70% of the papers. The event brought together over 200 participants, including distinguished keynote speakers, scholars, and researchers from Sri Lanka and abroad. Focused on the theme “Blending AI and Traditional Wisdom for Sustainable National Development,” ICAS 2025 also featured a Doctoral Symposium that provided a vibrant platform for emerging researchers to share their PhD work and connect with leading experts.

# Workshop on – University Ranking -Way Forward

September 2, 2025

The Staff Development Centre of the University of Vavuniya organized a workshop titled “University Ranking: Way Forward” on 2nd September 2025, from 2:00 PM to 4:00 PM at TCL 1, Faculty of Technological Studies. The workshop was aimed at academic and academic support staff and was conducted by Prof. R.G. Ragel, Professor in the Department of Computer Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, University of Peradeniya. The session focused on understanding the significance of university rankings, especially Webometrics ranking, and how the University of Vavuniya can strategically enhance its position in global academic visibility.

Participants gained insights into the various metrics used to calculate university rankings and the key areas requiring attention to improve the university’s standing. The workshop covered important topics such as the impacts of rankings, necessary actions to uplift the university’s profile, and specific ranking parameters including publication visibility, digital presence, and website optimization. Prof. Ragel also explained popular ranking systems, their grading categories, and less commonly known ranking criteria. Overall, the workshop equipped attendees with a comprehensive understanding of how university rankings work, what factors influence them, and the steps needed to enhance the University of Vavuniya’s academic reputation on a global scale.

# Empowering academic and executive staff to support students’ mental health

September 11, 2025

A Training programme titled “Empowering Academic and Executive Staff to Support Students’ Mental Health” was successfully conducted on 11th September 2025, from 10.00 am to 12.00 noon, at TLH 1 Hall, Faculty of Technological Studies. This programme was organized by the Support Centre for Persons with Disabilities (SCPD) with the objective of enhancing the knowledge and skills of academic staff in recognizing and supporting students facing mental health challenges.

The event began with a welcome speech delivered by Mrs.V.Kajanthy, the Director of SCPD, who emphasized the increasing importance of mental health awareness within higher education institutions. The Director highlighted the critical role that lecturers and academic staff play in creating a supportive learning environment and ensuring students’ well-being.

Following the welcome address, the training session was conducted by the resource person, Dr.M.Senavirathne, Consultant Psychiatrist (MBBS, MD) from the District General Hospital, Vavuniya. Dr.M.Senavirathne delivered an insightful and interactive presentation focused on understanding common mental health issues among students, identifying early warning signs, and developing effective communication and referral strategies. The presentation also covered practical approaches for academic staff to create a positive and inclusive atmosphere that promotes mental well-being.

A total of 20 academic and executive staff members from the University participated in the training. The session was highly engaging, with participants actively contributing to discussions and raising questions based on their experiences. The training provided valuable knowledge and tools to help academic staff become more confident and proactive in supporting students’ mental health needs. The programme concluded successfully at 12.00 noon, leaving the participants with a deeper understanding of their role in student support and mental health promotion. The SCPD intends to organize similar sessions in the future to further strengthen the mental health support framework within the faculty.

# Visit to the Centre for Prosthetics – Faculty of Engineering, University of Jaffna

September 24, 2025

A visit to the Centre for Prosthetics at the Faculty of Engineering, University of Jaffna, was conducted on 24th September 2025. The purpose of this visit was to gain valuable insights that could be incorporated into the Support Centre for Persons with Disabilities (SCPD) at the University of Vavuniya in order to strengthen its services to students and the wider community.

The visiting team from the SCPD consisted of Mrs. V. Kajanthy, Director of SCPD, Mr. J. Diroshan, Member of SCPD, and Ms. N. M. P. Rifana, Management Assistant of SCPD. The visit was facilitated by Dr. (Mrs.) T. Thanihaichelvan, Senior Lecturer and Head of the Department of Mechanical Engineering, while Mr. W. H. S. Wickramarathna, Lecturer in the Department of Mechanical Engineering, delivered a presentation on the functions and operations of the Centre for Prosthetics.

During the visit, it was observed that the Centre for Prosthetics provides significant support to both the university community and the general public in addressing the needs of individuals requiring prosthetic body parts. The Centre has also established strong links with few organizations, through which patients can be referred for advanced prosthetic solutions under a number of collaborative projects.

Through discussions, it was mutually agreed between the SCPD and the Centre for Prosthetics that there is considerable potential for collaboration. The Centre expressed its willingness to consider referrals from the SCPD, thereby enabling students and community members from the University of Vavuniya who require prosthetic support to benefit from the Centre’s facilities. Moreover, the Centre indicated that it could assist in facilitating access to specialized prosthetic fittings in India for such individuals through its existing projects. Overall, the visit proved to be highly valuable in identifying opportunities for partnership and knowledge exchange. The insights gained will contribute towards enhancing the services of the SCPD at the University of Vavuniya, particularly in supporting people with physical disabilities who require prosthetic interventions.

# Inauguration Ceremony of the Diploma in Early Childhood Education – Batch – II

September 7, 2025

The Inauguration Ceremony of the Diploma in Early Childhood Education – Batch II was held on 07th September 2025 at 10:00 AM at the Smart Lecture Hall, Faculty of Applied Science, Pambaimadu, University of Vavuniya. The event marked a significant milestone in the university’s ongoing commitment to the advancement of early childhood education. The ceremony was graced by several distinguished guests, including Senior Prof. A. Atputharajah, Vice Chancellor of the University of Vavuniya; Mr. S. A. Jude Leon, Director of the Centre for Distance and Continuing Education (CDCE); Eng. M. Sooriasegaram, President of the Education Development Consortium; Mr. Muralitharan, Assistant Director of Education (Pre-School), Vavuniya North; Dr. S. Shanmugathasan, Academic Coordinator; and Ms. Y. Vithushana, Assistant Registrar of CDCE.

Their esteemed presence added great value to the occasion, which served as an inspiring beginning for the new batch of students as they embark on their academic journey in the field of early childhood education. The programme is designed to equip students with the knowledge, skills, and practical experience necessary to become competent and compassionate early childhood educators.

# Sri Lanka University Games Track and Field Championship 2025

August 24, 2025

The Sri Lanka University Games Track and Field Championship 2025 was held at the Diyagama Mahinda Rajapaksa Stadium in Homagama on the 23rd and 24th of August. A total of 15 athletes from the University of Vavuniya participated in the event: 9 men and 6 women.

In individual performances:

- N. Janarthanan secured 3rd place in the discus throw event.
- K. Nithursha finished 4th in the 100m hurdles.

Other athletes did not place within the top eight in their respective events. In the overall team standings:

- The men’s team ranked 11th.
- The women’s team ranked 9th.
- The University of Vavuniya placed 11th overall among the 16 participating universities.

# World Entrepreneurs’ Days and Industrial Exhibition 2025

August 28, 2025

_**The University Business Linkage Cell (UBL), in collaboration with the Entrepreneurship and Small Business Management (ESBM) students of the University of Vavuniya, is proud to host the World Entrepreneurship Days and Industrial Exhibition 2025 on Monday, 25th August, and Tuesday, 26th August 2025, starting at 9:00 a.m. at the University of Vavuniya premises.**_

_**This flagship event is organized in partnership with government departments, industry stakeholders, and NGOs, bringing together a wide network of collaborators to celebrate and promote entrepreneurship.**_

_**The exhibition aims to,**_

- _**Promote innovation and creative thinking**_
- _**Showcase entrepreneurial talent across diverse sectors**_
- _**Strengthen linkages between academia, industry, and the community**_

_**Highlights of the event include,**_

- _**200+ stalls featuring innovative and unique products and services from entrepreneurs**_
- _**School student showcases, where young innovators will present their creative ideas and products**_
- _**Public engagement opportunities, making the event open to the wider community to foster collaboration and support for entrepreneurship**_
- **_Collaboration with_ _government departments, industry stakeholders, investors, exporters and academia_**

_**Join us to experience innovation, creativity, and community collaboration at its best!**_

# Russian Language Programme – Certificate Awarding Ceremony

August 14, 2025

The Chuvash I. Yakovlev State Pedagogical University arranged a basic Russian language programme for University of Vavuniya students. A total of 59 students completed their three-day course, and the certificate awarding ceremony was held on 14th August 2025 at IT

Centre Board Room, University of Vavuniya.

# Table Tennis Coaching Camp at University of Vavuniya

July 27, 2025

The Physical Education Unit of the University of Vavuniya, in collaboration with Sam’s College, successfully organised a two-day Table Tennis Coaching Camp on July 26 and 27, 2025, at the university’s indoor complex.

This initiative aimed to promote table tennis among students of various faculties, especially beginners, while fostering sportsmanship, teamwork, and interest in physical education. The camp featured a combination of introductory coaching sessions and basic umpire training and culminated in a friendly tournament, which was enthusiastically received by all participants.

Over 40 students from different academic backgrounds took part in the program, many of whom were new to the sport. The training was delivered by an experienced team of coaches from Sam’s College, who provided personalised attention and professional guidance, ensuring that every participant gained valuable insight into the game’s techniques and rules.

The umpire training component added an extra dimension to the camp, helping students understand the responsibilities of officiating a match and emphasising the importance of fair play and discipline in sports.

The Physical Education Unit extends its heartfelt gratitude to Mr. Shanmugam Samuel, Founder and CEO of Sam’s College, for his generous sponsorship and support in making this event a great success. His contribution enabled the provision of quality equipment, refreshments, and a comfortable environment for all participants.

This collaborative initiative not only enhanced student engagement in co-curricular activities but also laid the groundwork for a promising partnership between Sam’s College and the University of Vavuniya.

# Workshop on “Effective Teaching and Mentoring

July 8, 2025

The Staff Development Centre of the University of Vavuniya organized a workshop on “Effective Teaching and Mentoring” for academic and academic support staff on 08th July 2025 (Tuesday), from 2:00 PM to 4:00 PM at the Smart Lecture Hall, Faculty of Applied Science. The session was conducted by Professor N. Ravichandran, Professor of Civil Engineering at Clemson University, USA, who served as the resource person. A total of 48 participants attended the

workshop. The session focused on key topics such as understanding different student learning styles, effective teaching methods, mentoring strategies, and continuous assessment for improvement. Professor Ravichandran emphasized that students have eight distinct learning styles, and stressed the importance of creating an inclusive, student-centered learning environment.

He discussed various teaching strategies including interactive lectures, the use of technology and simulations, case-based and project-based learning, and the importance of regular feedback and ongoing assessment. Regarding mentoring, he highlighted the need for a clear mentoring philosophy, effective support strategies, and promoting diversity, equity, and inclusion.

The session concluded with a strong message on the value of inclusive, evolving teaching practices and the lifelong impact of effective mentorship in shaping students’ academic and personal growth.

# workshop on “Accreditation process”

June 18, 2025

The Staff Development Centre of the University of Vavuniya conducted a workshop titled
“Workshop on the Accreditation Process” on June 18, 2025, from 01:30 PM to 03:30 PM at the
Smart Lecture Hall, Faculty of Applied Sciences. Prof. Suresh Surendran, Visiting Professor in
Environmental Risk and Sustainable Development, Faculty of Business Studies served as the
resource person for this session. Aimed at academic, academic support, and administrative staff,
the primary objective of the workshop was to present a professional initiative focused on
enhancing the quality and global recognition of university degree programs. Prof. Suresh
Surendran introduced key aspects of accreditation, including institutional and programmatic
(module-based) processes, and emphasized its benefits in promoting excellence in education. He
discussed how accreditation aligns with core competencies in technical project management,
strategic and business management, and leadership. A significant part of the session was
dedicated to explaining, step by step, how the Department of Project Management successfully
carried out its own accreditation process, serving as a model for best practices. This detailed
explanation encouraged other departments to initiate and pursue accreditation for their respective
programs. The session also covered the development of innovative and sustainable curricula
designed to meet present and future educational needs, with real-world examples and emerging
tools offering participants practical insights into applying accreditation standards to enhance
academic quality and institutional competitiveness. Ms. S. Mathivathany, Head of the
Department of Project Management, who outlined the step-by-step accreditation journey
undertaken by her department, serving as a model for best practices. She expressed her gratitude
to the departmental staff for their dedication and teamwork, which played a vital role in the
success of the process. Prof.Y.Nanthgopan, Dean of the Faculty of Business Studies also
addressed the gathering, encouraging other departments to engage in the accreditation process
and praising the efforts of Prof. Suresh Surendran, Ms. Mathivathany, and their team for their
leadership and achievements. During the interactive session, participants raised important
questions about accreditation documentation, review criteria, timelines, and curriculum
alignment.

# Third Awarding and Fourth Inauguration Ceremony of the Certificate in Professional English

June 28, 2025

The Industry and Community Interaction Cell (ICIC), Faculty of Business Studies, University of Vavuniya, Sri Lanka, proudly hosted the awarding ceremony for the third batch and the inauguration ceremony for the fourth batch of the Certificate in Professional English course on June 28, 2025, at SH 4, University of Vavuniya.

During the ceremony, 49 students received certificates for successfully completing the course, while 30 new students were officially enrolled in the fourth batch. The event was graced by the distinguished guests, including the Chief Guest, Senior Professor A. Atputharajah, Vice Chancellor of the University; the Special Guest, Professor Y. Nanthagopan, Dean of the Faculty of Business Studies; the Guest of Honour, Mr. N. Rajavisahan, Registrar of the University; and Guests Mr. S. Douglus and Ms. P. Dileka, who serve as course resource persons. Also in attendance were Mr. S. Sivanenthira, ICIC Coordinator, and Mr. A. Sebarajah, Course Coordinator, who headed and coordinated the programme.

This ceremony marked a significant milestone in the academic journey of the award recipients and the incoming cohort. It underscored the University of Vavuniya’s continued commitment to delivering high-quality education and fostering professional development, benefiting both students and the broader community through the Certificate in Professional English course.

The following **forty-nine students were eligible,** and **two were not eligible** for the Certificate in Professional English at the 28th June 2025 Awarding Ceremony at the University of Vavuniya, Sri Lanka.

June 25, 2025

The Department of Marketing Management, Faculty of Business Studies, University of Vavuniya, signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with LOLC Life Assurance and LOLC General Insurance on 25th June, 2025 at the University of Vavuniya. The Honourable Vice Chancellor, Registrar, Dean of the Faculty of Business Studies, Dean of the Faculty of Technological Studies, Heads of the Departments, Assistant Registrar, the Academic staff of the Department of Marketing Management, and students, representing the University of Vavuniya. # The Staff Cricket Match 2025

April 25, 2025

The Physical Education Unit of the University of Vavuniya successfully organized a Staff Cricket Match, fostering camaraderie and sportsmanship among participants. The event was held on April 25, 2025, at the university playground at 4:00 PM, and it also served as the selection process for the University of Vavuniya Staff Cricket Team.

This match was played in memory of Prof. A. Pushpanathan, Senior Lecturer Mr. N. Thevaraja (Technical Officer), and Mr. S. Gnaneswaran (Supervisor), as a tribute to their invaluable contributions to the university. The final match took place on April 29, 2025, showcasing competitive yet respectful gameplay.

In the final match, the late Mr. N. Thevaraja’s team emerged as champions, Mr. S. Gnaneswaran’s team secured second place, and Prof. A. Pushpanathan’s team claimed third place. The tournament was not only a celebration of cricket but also a heartfelt honor to the legacy of remarkable individuals who played a significant role in the university’s journey.

# Inauguration Ceremony of the New Physical Education Unit Office

April 30, 2025

The inauguration ceremony of the new Physical Education Unit office at the University of Vavuniya took place on April 30, 2025, at 12:00 PM in the Staff Quarters. This relocation from the Indoor Complex marks a significant milestone for the unit, ushering in a new chapter of growth and development.

The event was graced by esteemed chief guests, including the Vice Chancellor, Registrar, Bursar, Deputy Registrar, Senior Assistant Registrar, Assistant Registrar, Engineer, Sports Advisory Board Chairman, and other dedicated staff members. Their presence emphasized the importance of this transition and their commitment to enhancing the Physical Education Unit’s facilities and operations.

The ceremony was a momentous occasion, celebrating progress, teamwork, and the dedication of all involved in making this transition successful.

# University of Vavuniya Students Showcase Athletic Talent at Reecha Park New Year Road Race

April 13, 2025

Students from the University of Vavuniya participated in the Reecha Park & Resort New Year Celebration Road Race, which was held on 13th April 2025, covering the route from Palai Town to Reecha Park. The event featured participants in the over-12 men’s and women’s age categories, showcasing both endurance and competitive spirit. Representing the university, R.Gowshiya, S.Manoj, and A.Jacob competed with enthusiasm and determination. In the women’s category, R.Gowshiya had secured 11th place, demonstrating remarkable endurance and skill. In the men’s category, S.Manoj finished in 23rd place, while A.Jacob had secured 25th place, further reflecting their dedication to long-distance running. Their participation in the event highlighted the university’s commitment to athletics and competitive sports.

# Awarding Ceremony of the Gavel Club

March 5, 2025

The Awarding Ceremony of the Gavel Club was successfully held on the 5th of March 2025 at TLH 1, Faculty of Technological Studies, University of Vavuniya. The event was organized by the Gavel Club under the guidance of the Career Guidance Unit of the University. The ceremony celebrated the achievements of Gavel Club members and acknowledged their progress in communication and leadership skills.

The Chief Guest of the event was Senior Prof. A. Atputharajah, Vice Chancellor of the University of Vavuniya. Special guests included TM. Arulneethan (President, Vavuniya Toastmasters Club), TM. Shamila (Vice President), TM. Laxmanraj (Sergeant-at-Arms), and TM. Sutharsan (Member). Their presence and encouraging speeches inspired the students to further develop their public speaking and leadership capabilities.

Many academic and Administrative staff members and students attended the event, making it a vibrant and inspiring celebration. The ceremony included speeches, certificate distribution, and motivational sharing sessions by the Toastmasters team. Overall, the event was a success, encouraging continued student engagement in leadership and public speaking through the Gavel Club platform.

# ELEVATE Film Screening & Discussion Event Successfully Held at the University of Vavuniya

February 19, 2025

The ELEVATE Film Screening & Discussion event was successfully held on February 19, 2025, at the University of Vavuniya, organized by the Centre for Gender Equity and Equality (CGEE) of the University of Vavuniya. This initiative, conducted in collaboration with the Centre for Media and Information Literacy and the University Grants Commission, aimed to raise awareness and promote discussions on Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights (SRHR) and Sexual and Gender-Based Violence (SGBV).

The event featured powerful short films created by young female undergraduates, using cinema as a tool to challenge societal norms and advocate for SRHR and SGBV awareness within the university community. Distinguished guests, including the Vice Chancellor, committee members of the Centre for Gender Equity and Equality, faculty members, Women Development Officials, and students, actively participated in thought-provoking discussions. The event highlighted the ability of short films to deliver impactful messages, regardless of their duration, while contributing to a more inclusive and informed future.

# Consultation with Stakeholders Organized by Support Center for Persons with Disabilities on Implementing Certificate Courses

March 4, 2025

The Support Center for Persons with Disabilities (SCPD) at the University of Vavuniya organized a stakeholder meeting on March 4, 2025, at the Pampaimadu premises of the University to assess the feasibility of introducing two new certificate courses: the _Advanced Certificate in Transformative Disability Awareness_ and the _Certificate in Sign Language (Beginner Level)_. The meeting aimed to identify the requirements for these courses, discuss the proposed curriculum, and gather recommendations for potential students.

The meeting was honored by the presence of various stakeholders, including representatives from Vaazhvaham, Yaazhl Association for the Visually Handicapped, Karuvi Organization, Shamrock Familian, ChildFund Organization, Organization for the Rehabilitation of the Handicapped (ORHAN) along with the Disabled People’s Organizations from Jaffna, Mullaitivu, Vavuniya, and Mannar. Prof.Jennifer George, Head of Computing at Goldsmiths, University of London, also joined the meeting via Zoom and made an invaluable contribution. The event was further distinguished by the participation of Senior Prof.A.Atputharajah, Vice Chancellor of the University, Mr.N.Rajavishagan, Registrar of the University, Dr.M.Malaravan, Consultant Eye Surgeon and Council member of the University,  Mr.V.Senthooran, Dean of the Faculty of Technological Studies, Dr.S.Suthakaran, Psychiatrist, Vavuniya General Hospital, Ms.V.Kajanthy, Director of SCPD, Mr.V.Subramaniam, Coordinator of SCPD, and members of SCPD.

The meeting began with a welcome address by the Director of SCPD, followed by speeches from the Vice Chancellor and a Council Member, highlighting the significance of launching the proposed certificate courses. The course proposals were then presented and clarified by the Center’s Coordinator. The meeting concluded with an engaging discussion, paving the way for the successful implementation of the initiatives. The event wrapped up with a vote of thanks delivered by the Director of the Center.

# Tree Plantation – By – ( CS and IT Fourth Year Student 2019/2020 Batch)

February 18, 2025

![](https://vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/03/DOF-TP-CS-IT-4th-Year-Batch-2019-2020-896x1024.jpg)

On the final day of the academic year, the students of the **Computer Science and Information Technology (2019/2020 Batch – 4th Year)** at the **Faculty of Applied Science, University of Vavuniya**, participated in a meaningful tree plantation with the staff of the Faculty, the students planted **_Delonix regia_**, commonly known as the Flame Tree, as part of the **“Donation Program – Tree Plantation”** organized by the Landscape Division.

This event not only aimed to enhance the **university’s green environment and landscape** but also served as a heartfelt **remembrance** of the time spent at the Faculty by the students. The tree planting activity reflects a commitment to sustainability and environmental stewardship, fostering a sense of community and responsibility among students and faculty alike.

As the _Delonix regia_ matures, it will stand as a **lasting symbol** of the students’ growth during their academic journey, while also contributing to the ecological well-being of the university campus.

# Inauguration Ceremony of the Certificate in Entrepreneurship and Small Business Management Program (Batch-3)

February 15, 2025

The inauguration ceremony for the third batch of the Certificate in Entrepreneurship and Small Business Management (CESBM) program was held on February 15, 2025, at the Park Road premises of the University of Vavuniya. The event marked the commencement of a new academic journey for aspiring entrepreneurs, reinforcing the university’s commitment to fostering entrepreneurial education and small business development.

The ceremony was graced by the presence of esteemed guests, including Mr. S. Santhirabalan, Managing Director of Marutham Pvt. Ltd, and Mr. Thabenthiran, Mullaitivu and Vavuniya Vidatha Officer. The event was further honoured by the participation of the Vice Chancellor, Registrar, Dean of the Faculty of Technological Studies, Dean of the Faculty of Applied Sciences, Director of the Centre for Distance and Continuing Education (CDCE), Director of the University Business Linkage (UBL), Program Coordinator of CESBM, Assistant Registrar of CDCE, and staff members of CDCE.

The program commenced with a welcome speech, followed by remarks from distinguished guests who emphasized the importance of entrepreneurship in economic growth and self-sufficiency. The session concluded with an interactive discussion, encouraging students to leverage the program for their professional and business development. The event successfully set the stage for an enriching learning experience for the new batch of students.

# Business Idea Presentation and Discussion with Dr. Nithiyananthan

January 8, 2025

The University Business Linkage (UBL) of the University of Vavuniya organized a Business Idea Presentation and Discussion on February 8, 2025, in collaboration with Dr. Nithiyananthan from Radnam Foundation, UK. The event, held at the IT Centre Board Room, aimed to support local entrepreneurs by providing seed funding opportunities for business expansion.

Twelve entrepreneurs from various sectors, including agriculture, garments, food production, and manufacturing, presented their business ideas. Each presentation covered business models, target markets, and growth strategies, followed by a Q&A session. Dr. Nithiyananthan provided constructive feedback on financial planning, market expansion, sustainability, operational efficiency, and technology integration. Entrepreneurs were requested to submit refined business summaries for further evaluation and potential funding. Dr. Nithiyananthan expressed commitment to supporting eligible businesses.

The event concluded with a group photograph, marking a successful engagement. This initiative provided valuable mentorship and funding opportunities, reinforcing UBL’s efforts to strengthen the entrepreneurial ecosystem and drive economic growth in the region.

# 3rd Anniversary Road Race competition – 2025

February 22, 2025

The Physical Education Unit of the University of Vavuniya organized the 3rd Anniversary Road Race competition on 22nd February 2025. The event featured four categories: Under 15 Men, Under 15 Women, over 15 Men, and Over 15 Women. The race commenced at 7:15 AM, starting from the University of Vavuniya park road premises to concluding at Pambaimadu.

The Chief Guest for the occasion was the Vice Chancellor of the University, Prof. Arulampalam Atputharajah, and Mr. T. Kanthasamy served as the Special Guest. The prize-giving ceremony took place at 9:00 AM in front of the IT Center at the University of Vavuniya.

In the Under 15 categories, S. Anushan -V/Suntharapuram G. T. M. S secured first place for Boys, while T. Abishalini – V/Mathar panikkar mahilankulam J. S.V took first place for Girls. In the Over 15 Men’s category, I. Vikirthan – V/Poovarasankulam.M.V was the winner, and R. Gowshiya – University of Vavuniya claimed first place in the Over 15 Women’s category.

Prizes were distributed for the top three winners in each category, with cash prizes awarded by our Chief Guest and Special Guest. Additionally, trophies were presented to the top ten winners, and all participants received certificates for their involvement in the Road Race competition.

At the conclusion of the event, Mr. R. Sivasegaran expressed gratitude to everyone who contributed to the success of the competition

# Business Coaching Session for Entrepreneurs and Ideapreneurs

February 4, 2025

A Business Coaching session for Entrepreneurs and Ideapreneurs was held on February 4, 2025, at the Board Room, IT Centre, University of Vavuniya. The session was conducted by Mr. Kula Sellathurai, Lead Entrepreneurship and Business Coach, President of the Canada-Sri Lanka Business Convention, and CEO of Netwyn Industry.

A total of 30 external entrepreneurs and 15 university undergraduates (ideapreneurs) participated in the session. The coaching was structured through a common coaching method, followed by interactive one-on-one sessions, enabling participants to receive personalized insights on business growth, idea development, and entrepreneurial strategies. The session provided valuable guidance on business expansion, market strategies, and innovation, fostering a strong entrepreneurial mindset among attendees. Participants actively engaged with the trainer, discussing their business challenges and gaining expert advice tailored to their specific needs.

Mr. Sellathurai expressed his willingness to continue training online in the future and showed interest in supporting the establishment of the proposed Marketing Centre at the University. The event, successfully organized by the Business Linkage Cell, University of Vavuniya, provided emerging entrepreneurs with essential guidance and networking opportunities, strengthening their ability to navigate the business landscape and drive sustainable growth.

# Art Competition Organized by HR Club

February 6, 2025

The HR Club of the Faculty of Business Studies University of Vavuniya successfully organized an art competition on the theme “Unity in Diversity” on 6th February 2025. This competition aimed to encourage students to express their thoughts on cultural harmony, inclusivity, and the beauty of diversity through artistic creativity. The event witnessed enthusiastic participation from students across various faculties, making it a remarkable success. The competition was held at the BH2 Lecture Hall, Faculty of Business Studies and commenced at 3.30 PM with an inaugural speech by the President of the HR Club, who highlighted the importance of unity in a diverse society. Participants were given one hour to complete their artwork.

A total of 18 students participated in the competition, presenting a diverse range of artistic interpretations of the theme. The artworks depicted messages of peace, togetherness, cultural richness, and social harmony. Some of the key elements portrayed in the paintings included interwoven hands and flags symbolizing cultural integration, multicultural festivals showcasing religious and traditional harmony, and diverse communities holding hands to represent solidarity. The participants were evaluated based on creativity and originality, relevance to the theme, artistic skill and technique, and overall presentation and impact. The evaluations will be one by experts and three best drawings will be selected.

The competition served as a platform for students to showcase their artistic talents while reinforcing the values of unity, diversity, and inclusivity. The enthusiasm and talent displayed by the students have inspired the club to organize similar events in the future to continue fostering creativity and inclusivity within the university.

# Certificate Awarding Ceremony of Russian Language

February 15, 2025

The certificate awarding ceremony took place on February 15, 2025, at the Smart Lecture Hall, Faculty of Applied Science, University of Vavuniya. During the event, certificates were presented to the second batch of students who successfully completed the Russian Language Programme. The course began on September 13, 2025, and concluded on October 28, 2025. A total of 31 students completed the programme and received their certificates.

H.E. Mr. Lavan S. Dzhagaryan, Ambassador of the Russian Federation in the democratic Socialist republic of Sri Lanka and to the republic of Maldives. Vice Chancellor, Registrar, Dean/ Faculty of Applied Science, Dean/ Faculty of Technological Studies, Head/ Dept. of Marketing management, Project Management and ICT, University of Vavuniya. Mr. Alexey Tseleshechev, Head of the Political Section of the Russian Embassy. (Via Zoom). Mr. Chamila Jayarathna, Chargé d’Affaires a.i. /Of the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Russia (Via Zoom).  Ms. Svetlana Ilyina, Vice Rector for Academic Affairs, Yakovlev State Pedagogical University, Russia (Via Zoom)

# MoU Signing between AIA Insurance Lanka Limited and University of Vavuniya

February 7, 2025

The AIA Insurance Lanka Limited and the University of Vavuniya signed a Memorandum of Understanding to facilitate academic collaboration, knowledge exchange, and capacity building to execute the spirit of cooperation between the parties in order to develop competent insurance professionals to serve the region and the nation. The signing event held on 07th February 2025 at Board room, Faculty of Business Studies, University of Vavuniya. AIA is a long-term insurance provider in Sri Lanka offering customized insurance services to its customers by providing a range of tailor-made insurance solutions.

Prof. A. Atputharajah, Vice-Chancellor University of Vavuniya, Prof. Y. Nanthagopan, Dean, Faculty of Business Studies, Dr. K. Kalainathan, Head, Department of Finance and Accountancy other heads of Department, Registrar, Bursar and Lecturers from Department of Finance and Accountancy have represented on behalf  of the University of Vavuniya. Mr.Chanaka Liyanage, Chief Agency Officer, Mr.Selavarajan Kandasamy, Provincial Manager of AIA, Northern Region, Mr. P.P.K.Piayasena, Branch Manager, Mr.Arumugam Thushiyanthan,Manager AIA Sirlanka Academey have represented AIA Insurance Lanka Limited. The MoU entails various mutual benefits to the AIA and University of Vavuniya. Accordingly, the AIA will offer the internship opportunity to the students and will facilitate the participation to students in workshops, seminars, training programs, experience sharing events, and other professional initiatives.

The AIA and the University of Vavuniya to collaboratively organize competencies and skills development initiatives for the undergraduates and enhancing the employability of undergraduates of the Department of Finance and Accountancy of the Faculty of Business Studies, University of Vavuniya through capacity building initiatives.

# Workshop on Entrepreneurial Mindsets

January 22, 2025

The University Business Linkage Cell, in collaboration with the Career Guidance Unit, University of Vavuniya, successfully organized a workshop on “Entrepreneurial Mindsets” for undergraduate students on January 22, 2025, at SH4, Soosairatnam Building, University of Vavuniya.

Prof. Ganesh Rajah, Professor and Executive Director of the Centre for Executives and Professional Development, London, UK, and an Advisory Board Member of the University Business Linkages (UBL), served as the resource person.

The workshop provided insights into entrepreneurial thinking, problem-solving, and innovation, equipping students with essential skills for business success. More than 250 students actively participated, engaging in discussions and clarifying their doubts. The interactive session enabled students to gain valuable entrepreneurial skills and fostered a proactive mindset toward business and leadership.

The event was a significant step in encouraging students to develop an entrepreneurial attitude, empowering them with knowledge to navigate the evolving business landscape.

# Leadership Training Program and Certificate Awarding for Undergraduates

January 27, 2025

The Career Guidance Unit of the University of Vavuniya organized a Leadership Training Program for undergraduates from January 27th to 30th, 2025. The program was conducted in collaboration with Vision Global Empowerment, Sri Lanka, and the Ratnam Foundation, UK, and was held on the university premises.

The program aimed to enhance the personal and professional leadership skills of the participants. It focused on self-reflection and practical application of leadership concepts. Participants explored the qualities of an effective leader and developed their own definitions of leadership. The training covered various aspects of personal leadership skills, enabling participants to identify and cultivate their strengths.

Thirty-five selected undergraduates actively participated in the program. They gained valuable leadership skills through interactive sessions and group activities. On the final day, the participants, divided into groups, presented social action plans for future implementation. These plans were developed with the support of Vision Global Empowerment, ensuring their feasibility and potential impact.

The program concluded with a certificate distribution ceremony. The Vice Chancellor of the University presented certificates to each participant, recognizing their successful completion of the training. The Leadership Training Program proved to be highly impactful, equipping the undergraduates with essential skills to excel as future leaders.

# Second Awarding and Third Inauguration Ceremony of Certificate in Professional English

January 26, 2025

The University of Vavuniya, Sri Lanka, proudly hosted the second awarding ceremony for the second batch and the inauguration ceremony for the third batch of the Certificate in Professional English course on January 26, 2025, at SH 4, University of Vavuniya. The course is coordinated by the Industry and Community Interaction Cell (ICIC) of the Faculty of Business Studies in collaboration with the Department of English Language Teaching (DELT).

During the ceremony, 25 students were awarded certificates for successfully completing the course, while 40 new students registered for the third batch. The event was graced by several distinguished guests, including the Chief Guest, Senior Prof. A. Atputharajah, Vice Chancellor of the University; Special Guest, Prof. Y. Nanthagopan, Dean of the Faculty of Business Studies; and Guest Ms. D. Gapila, one of the course resource persons. The ceremony was also attended by Mr. S. Sivanenthira, the ICIC Coordinator, and Mr. A. Sebarajah, the course coordinator, who headed and coordinated the programme.

This ceremony marked an important milestone in the academic journey of the awardees and the incoming batch of students. It reflected the University of Vavuniya’s continued commitment to providing high-quality education and professional development opportunities, benefitting both students and the broader community through the Certificate in Professional English course.

# TOEFL Benchmarked Speaking and Writing Workshop

January 16, 2025

From January 16th to 18th, 2025, the University of Vavuniya hosted a three-day TOEFL Benchmarked Speaking and Writing Workshop, facilitated by Jennifer Goodman, an English Language Fellow enlisted by the USA Education Ministry and facilitated by the U.S. State Department. The workshop was designed to enhance the speaking and writing skills of students and faculty members, benchmarked to TOEFL standards. It catered to participants from various faculties, including Business Studies, Technological Studies, and Applied Science, as well as staff from the Department of English Language Teaching (DELT). Additionally, a session was held for A/L-qualified participants at Siththivinayagar School, Mannar. The workshops, conducted at designated venues within the university, aimed to develop participants’ ability to perform effectively in the TOEFL speaking and writing activities, focusing on critical components such as clarity, coherence, and academic writing.

# Advanced Workshop on Idea Generation and Business Development for Entrepreneurs

November 23, 2024

The University Business Linkage Cell, University of Vavuniya, in collaboration with the GATE Institute, UK, jointly organized an “Advanced Workshop on Idea Generation and Business Development for Entrepreneurs.” In the University premises, Pampaimadu, Vavuniya on 23rd of November 2024 at 9.00am to 4.00pm. This workshop is designed for established entrepreneurs, early-stage entrepreneurs, students with business ideas, and aspiring entrepreneurs to empowering entrepreneurs, honoring business ideas, fostering the creation of new products, and accelerating growth. Nearly 170 participants attended the event, which began with registration and the lighting of the traditional lamp. Distinguished guests, including Dr. M. Arumukam (Chairman of the Startup Committee & Foundation, Member of the TANSAM Centre of Excellence, Tamil Nadu, India), Mr. P. Parthipan (Vice President, Device Programs at Peloton Interactive, California, USA & Co-Founder and Managing Partner, Tamil Ventures LP.), and Mr. M. Thabenthiran (District Vidatha Officer, District Secretariat, Vavuniya and Mullaitivu), attended as special guests. The Chief Guest, Sevithi Sai Murali, the Consul General of India in Jaffna, also graced the occasion.

Nearly 175 participants participated this workshop. The event began with the registration of participants and Traditional customs were honored with the lighting of the traditional lamp.

Then officially event commenced with a welcome address by Ms. S. Mathivathany, Director of the Business Linkage Cell, followed by an introductory speech by Dr. S. Senthan, CEO of the GATE Institute, UK. Mr. K. Jeyaraj introduced the “GATE for Innovation, Venture & Entrepreneurship” program, while Prof. Y. Nanthagopan, Dean of the Faculty of Business Studies, delivered a key speech on the importance of innovation and entrepreneurship in economic growth. Mr. P. Sasitharan, Programme Coordinator for Entrepreneurship and Business Management at the University of Vavuniya, spoke on the “Power of a Business Plan for an Entrepreneur.” Prof. A. Atputharajah, Vice Chancellor of the University of Vavuniya, also delivered a speech on importance of the digital innovation for the entrepreneurship development. The session on “Entrepreneurship and Innovation” was delivered by Dr. M. Arumukam, while Mr. Parthipan Paramsothy led a session on “Lessons from Global Perspectives.”

The workshop fostered a deeper understanding of the local and global entrepreneurial landscape, helping participants identify new market opportunities, trends, and challenges. The final registration of entrepreneurs into the GIVE platform was another key benefit, as it provided ongoing support and resources for participants to scale their businesses. Overall, the workshop empowered participants to refine their business ideas, expand their networks, and accelerate the growth of their entrepreneurial ventures.

Participants gained valuable insights into local and global entrepreneurial landscapes, helping them identify market opportunities, trends, and challenges. Through expert sessions, participants were empowered to refine their business ideas and learn practical strategies for creating innovative products and services. Also, the event fostered connections among entrepreneurs, students, and industry experts, laying the groundwork for collaborations and mentorship opportunities. Entrepreneurs were registered into the GIVE platform, which will provide ongoing support, mentorship, and resources for business growth.

It successfully empowered entrepreneurs, honored innovative ideas, and accelerated entrepreneurial growth through a comprehensive agenda of interactive sessions, expert guidance, and networking opportunities. This initiative highlights the collaborative efforts of the University Business Linkage Cell and the GATE Institute in advancing entrepreneurship, not just locally but with a global outlook, fostering the economic and innovative growth of the region.

# Commencement of Work – 2025

January 1, 2025

The University of Vavuniya ceremonially commenced duties of the New Year on the 1st of January 2025 with a special function attended by Professor A. Atputharajah, the Vice-Chancellor, along with Deans of Faculties, Mr N. Rajavisagan, Registrar, Bursar and all other staff members of the University. The function commenced with the hoisting of the national and university flags by the vice chancellor and registrar, followed by the singing of the national anthem. Subsequently, the Public Servants’ Oath was read by the Registrar, which was followed by the staff of the university.

# Staff Badminton Tournament – 2024

December 18, 2024

The University of Vavuniya’s Physical Education Unit successfully organized the Staff Badminton Tournament on December 18, 2024, at the Indoor Sports Complex, aimed at promoting physical fitness and fostering team spirit among staff members. Emphasizing the tournament’s role in enhancing workplace morale, reducing stress, and fostering a sense of community among staff members in the fast-paced academic environment.

The event commenced with a warm welcome from the coordinator, Mr. R. Sivasegaran, followed by an encouraging address from the chief guest, Vice Chancellor Prof. Arulampalam Atputharajah, along with other esteemed guests, including the registrar, Mr N. Rajavisahan, and the dean of the Faculty of Technological Studies, Mr V. Senthooran.

The matches kicked off at 2:30 PM and continued until 7:30 PM, showcasing remarkable talent and sportsmanship. Recognizing outstanding performances, certificates and trophies were awarded to the winners, with S. Sanjayan claiming victory in men’s singles, R. Tharshika in women’s singles, S. Ketheesvaran and Pushpakanthan in men’s doubles, and the duo of S. Ketheesvaran and R. Tharshika in mixed doubles.

The event concluded with a heartfelt thank you speech by Ms G. Thusyanthy.

# The Christian Society, in collaboration with the Harmony Centre, organized the Light Festival

December 11, 2024

The Christian Society, in collaboration with the Harmony Centre, organized the Light Festival “Gaudium Natalis” of the University of Vavuniya on the 11th of December 2024 at 3.30 PM.

**His Lordship Ret. Rev. Dr. Emmanual Fernando,** the Bishop of the Mannar Diocese, graced the occasion as the Chief Guest along with Rev. Fr. Christunayagam, the Vicar General of the Diocese of Mannar; Professor A. Atputharajah, the Vice Chancellor of the University of Vavuniya; and Rev. Fr. Soosainayagam, Parish Priest at Divine Mercy Shrine Pampaimad.

Around 500 participants have participated, including Rev. Fathers, Rev. Sisters, pastors of Christian ministries and churches, deans of the faculties, the registrar, the bursar, academics, administrative and staff members of the university, and students of all faculties.

Various performances have been performed by the students’ including carol songs in Sinhala, Tamil, and English, and dramas depicting the birth of Jesus Christ.

# Presentation of the Token of Gratitude for Being the Pilot Institute in IEEE YESIST12

September 7, 2024

2024 (Youth Endeavors for Social Innovation Using Sustainable Technology) The IEEE YESIST12 is a global platform for student innovation designed to promote innovation aligned with the UN Sustainable Development Goals. It inspires young minds to adopt service-orientated engineering practices, addressing humanitarian and social issues through innovative ideas. Pilots for the IEEEYESIST12 are selected worldwide to host the preliminary round of IEEE YESIST12 from individuals, IEEE members, sections, universities, and industry enthusiasts who are eager to contribute to fostering innovation. A pilot plays a pivotal role in conducting the preliminary round of this esteemed competition.

This year in IEEEYESIST12 2024, Ms. Masma Sajahan from the University of Vavuniya was selected as one of the Pilot Single Points of Coordination (SPOC) from Sri Lanka. Under her guidance, eight teams from the University of Vavuniya participated in the preliminary round, “IEEEYESIST12 2024 Prelims”. Their projects showcased a range of innovative solutions driven by a passion for societal impact. Esteemed jury members Dr Gunjan Varshney and Mr. Pradeepkumar Bharadwaj meticulously evaluated the presentations. Two teams, “VAGenix” and “Quantum Quest”, from the innovation track, were selected to advance to the grand finale, representing the University of Vavuniya. The grand finale was held at Tunis Science City, Tunisia, on the 7th and 8th of September 2024. Participants gained valuable benefits, including opportunities for innovation, professional networking, global exposure, teamwork, idea refinement, and practical experience.

Ms. Masma Sajahan received a certificate of appreciation from the IEEE YESIST12 and IEEE Tunisia Section as recognition of her contributions as Pilot SPOC at the grand finale. A letter of gratitude was presented to the University of Vavuniya for its outstanding contribution as a pilot institution. Prof. A. Atputharajah, Vice Chancellor of the University of Vavuniya, presented the certificate to Ms. Sajahan at the Vice Chancellor’s Board Room, University of Vavuniya, appreciating her dedication and the university’s commitment to fostering young innovators.

# FOOD FEST 2024

December 3, 2024

We are delighted to share the successful completion of the Food Stall held on 3rd December 2024 near the Environmental Chemistry Laboratory (ECL), Department of Bioscience, Faculty of Applied Science. This event was proudly organized by the second-year students of the Department of Bioscience, in collaboration with the Environmental Science Society, as part of the course ENS 2123 – Food, Nutrition, and Environment. Ms. K.G.S. Madhushani (Practical In-Charge of the subject) coordinated the activity and guided the students with consultation of Dr (Mrs) J. Nimalan, lecturer In-Charge of the subject.

The food stall focused on promoting the importance of healthy, homemade food choices while raising awareness of the nutritional benefits of pulses and legumes.

A variety of delicious, wholesome treats were offered, including:

- Healthy Salad
- Corn Soup
- Magic Corn
- Popcorn
- Cassava Chips
- Boiled Cassava

The event saw an overwhelming response from staff and students across all three faculties, creating a lively atmosphere filled with enthusiasm and collaboration. The proceeds from the stall will be entirely dedicated to the Annual Nutritional Assessment Programme for Preschool Students, ensuring that the funds are used for a meaningful and impactful cause.

This initiative not only brought the community together but also highlighted the importance of integrating academic learning with practical, real-world applications. The success of the food stall is a testament to the hard work and commitment of the students and the support of everyone who participated.

We extend our heartfelt thanks to everyone who joined us in this celebration of health, community, and purpose. Your contribution has made a lasting difference, and we look forward to more such impactful events in the future.

# Opening of the Integrated Digital Media Unit, University of Vavuniya

October 25, 2024

**Event Date:** October 25, 2024

**Location:** Integrated Digital Media Unit, New Library Building, 3rd Floor, University of Vavuniya

**Time:** 1:30 PM to 2:30 PM

The University of Vavuniya celebrated the official opening of its new Integrated Audio-Visual Unit, a facility designed to promote digital literacy and peacebuilding through advanced media and IT resources. This development was made possible through support from USAID Sri Lanka’s SCORE activity, which provided $30,000 worth of media and IT equipment to enhance the unit’s capabilities and foster social cohesion across the region and which aims to foster social cohesion and resilience.

The agenda highlighted the following:

1. **Traditional Welcome and Lighting of the Lamp**

The ceremony began with a traditional welcome and lighting of the ceremonial lamp, symbolizing enlightenment and prosperity.
2. **Ceremonial Opening and Welcome Remarks**

Ms. Julie Chung, US Ambassador to Sri Lanka; USAID Sri Lanka’s SCORE activity team; Prof. A. Atputharaja, Vice Chancellor, University of Vavuniya; and university representatives formally inaugurated the unit, followed by welcome remarks.
3. **Special Remarks**
   - **Prof. A. Atputharaja, Vice Chancellor, University of Vavuniya,** addressed the welcome and significance of the new unit in enhancing educational resources (radiography, videography, livestreaming, recording, editing, post-production and documentation, conference system, and discussions) and fostering unity within the university community.
   - **Ms. Julie Chung, US Ambassador to Sri Lanka, e** mphasized the collaborative efforts to improve digital access and skills for peacebuilding, underscoring the U.S. commitment to supporting such initiatives.
4. **Discussions** with university officials, academics, and students discussed the unit’s role in supporting peace and digital learning, with a focus on the broader impact across the region. Mainly discussed SME Hub development, Incubation Center startups, innovative production, AI and gem technology, student club programs, distance learning, remote lecturing, and teaching for rural villages.
5. **Presentation of Memento**

The university presented a memento to Ambassador Julie Chung in appreciation of the U.S. support for the unit through the USAID SCORE Activity. This token of gratitude acknowledged the American people’s generosity in equipping the unit and expressed sincere thanks for the ambassador’s valuable contributions to the project.

The event concluded with a formal closing photography session, celebrating the successful establishment of this vital resource. The Integrated Digital Media Unit is expected to serve as a hub for digital marketing and education for the MSME owners, community engagement, and peacebuilding, actively involving the university’s diverse community in unity-building efforts across the region.

# Vice Chancellor Award for  Research Excellence – 2024

November 20, 2024

The University Research Committee will conduct the awarding ceremony on 20th November 2024, from 2.00 pm to 3.00 pm, to present to the winners. The awardees are Dr Ratnarajah Nagulan (Senior Lecturer, Department of Physical Science, Faculty of Applied Science) in the field of Engineering, Architecture, and Technology and Dr (Mrs) Sukanyah Devaisy (Senior Lecturer, Department of Bioscience, Faculty of Applied Science).

The ceremony saw the participation of nearly 60 staff members from the University of Vavuniya, who gathered to support and celebrate the awardees. The Vice Chancellor and the three Deans appreciated the achievements of the award winners and delivered speeches, encouraging all staff members to engage in scholarly work. Both award winners shared motivational speeches, reflecting on their research journeys and experiences, inspiring others to pursue research and innovation.

# Collaborative Discussion with British Council Officials

December 4, 2024

On December 4, 2024, a productive and insightful meeting was held in the Board Room of the IT Centre with representatives from the British Council, Mr. Dominic Hudson, Director of Exams, and Mr. Ramani Vaheesan, Business Development Consultant. The meeting brought together key university officials, including the Vice-Chancellor, Prof. A. Atputharajah, the Registrar, Mr. N. Rajavisahan, Acting Librarian, Mr. S. Shanmugathasan, Director of the IT Centre, Mr. N. Edwin Linosh, and the British Council Coordinator, Ms. P. Sarmatha. The discussions centered on fostering collaboration between the university and the British Council, focusing on several strategic initiatives to benefit students and the wider community. This meeting also marked the establishment of a “British Corner” within the university library, aimed at providing students and staff with access to a rich array of resources on English language learning and International English Language Testing System (IELTS). This will strengthen the university’s commitment to empowering its students with globally relevant skills and resources ways to enhance the integration of IELTS practice modules in the university’s computer labs, facilitating hands-on preparation for students aspiring to take the exam. Additionally, the meeting emphasized to encourage the use of English language learning apps among students and promote community engagement in language development. This meeting was organized by the British Council Coordinator, Ms.P. Sarmatha.

# 5th Annual Research Session – FARS2024

October 30, 2024

The fifth Faculty Annual Research Session (FARS-2024) of the Faculty of Applied Science was held on October 30, 2024 on the theme of “Exploring Science for Humanity”. The FARS-2024 incorporated Annual student congress (ASRC-2024) which encouraged the undergraduate students to submit abstracts along with poster presentation Annual research session included together scientific findings from both biological and physical sciences, covering tracks such as Mathematics and Statistics, Computer Science and Software Engineering, Information Technology and Information Systems, Agriculture and Biosystems Technology, Environmental Science, and Life Sciences. Professor V.  Dhayalan (Department of Computer science, Electrical engineering and Mathematical sciences, Western Norway University of Applied Sciences , Campus Bergen, Norway ) was invited as chief gust for the session.

# Navigating Access to IELTS Test Registration

November 10, 2024

In collaboration with the University of Vavuniya, the British Council of Sri Lanka is offering a QR code that allows users to schedule an IELTS test and access 40 free practice exams. Professor A. Atputharajah, Vice Chancellor of the University of Vavuniya, received the QR code from Ms. P. Sarmatha, the British Council Coordinator of the University of Vavuniya. Dr. S. Shanmugathasan, Acting Librarian, facilitates the QR code accessibility to both students and staff by displaying it on the notice boards of each faculty, the university library, and the Examination and Student Admissions Branch.
