# Workshop on Montessori Child Education at University of Vavuniya

September 17, 2024

Researchers in early childhood education pointed out that we need to recognize the importance of ongoing learning and development for all staff working in early childhood education and care centers as the study into early childhood education finds children with access to early childhood education and care are significantly more likely to go into tertiary education.

With this in mind, the University of Vavuniya and Care for Education (NGO) are planning to hold continuing education workshops for the professional development of early childhood teachers. The first workshop was Montessori Child Education workshop held from 13th to the 17th of September 2024, for 114 early childhood teachers at the University of Vavuniya in partnership with Care for Education, which generously funded the entire event. Teachers from Jaffna, Mullaitivu, Mannar, Vavuniya and upcountry participated in this session.

The event was inaugurated by the Vice-Chancellor of the University of Vavuniya, Prof. A. Atputharajah. The curriculum for the workshop was designed by esteemed resource person Ms. Kavipriya Velusamy, Montessori and Phonics Educator from Sri Balaji Vocational Skill Development Academy, Tamil Nadu, India. The workshop was filled with hands-on activities and interactive learning aimed at enhancing experience in Montessori Child Education.

On the final day of the event, President of Care for Education Ms. Sinthuka Vivekanathan and Mr. Gengatharan Chelliah, the Accountant, participated along with the Vice- Chancellor and presented certificates to the participants.  The workshop was planned by Dr. (Mrs). P. S. Skantharajah, Project Advisor, Care for Education with the assistant of Ms. Shobana Raja, Project Coordinator, Care for Education. The management of the event was done by Mr. S. Shanmugathasan, Librarian (Actg.) and the Academic Coordinator of the Diploma in Early Childhood Education. This was a memorable and enriching experience for all involved.

# Prof. A. Atputharajah Assumed Duties as Vice-Chancellor on 08.07.2024

July 8, 2024

**University of Vavuniya Welcomes the Newly Appointed Vice Chancellor**

Professor Arulampalam Atputharajah has assumed the esteemed position of Vice-Chancellor at the University of Vavuniya, effective July 8, 2024, appointed by the Honorable President under Section 34(1)(a) of the Universities Act No: 16 of 1978, as amended. He formally commenced his duties on July 8th amidst the presence of university staff.

To mark this significant milestone, a ceremonial event was held at 9:00 am on July 8, 2024 in the lecture hall of the Faculty of Technological Studies.

Dr. S. Mohanadas (Chancellor), Prof. T. Mangaleswaran (Outgoing Vice-Chancellor), Deans of Faculties, Registrar, Acting Librarian, Bursar, University Council members, Heads of Departments, Professors, Directors of Centers and Units, Executive Officers, Lecturers, Academic Support Staff, and well-wishers join in extending their heartfelt congratulations and best wishes to Professor Arulampalam Atputharajah for his future endeavors.

Immediately after this ceremonial event, the Vice Chancellor had a discussion with Deans, Heads of Departments, Professors, Directors and Administrative Officers in the Boardroom of the IT Centre.

# Special Meeting with Assist RR Dr. Mark Penny and Donna Visited our University

March 7, 2024

The Support Center for Persons with Disabilities (SCPD) orchestrated a special meeting wherein Dr. V. Sarveswaran, Chairman of Assist Resettlement & Renaissance (Assist RR), accompanied by Mr. Mark Penney and Mrs. Donna E. Penney from Solihull School in the United Kingdom, visited the University of Vavuniya on March 7, 2024. During their visit, discussions ensued between the Vice-Chancellor of the University of Vavuniya, the Director, members of the Management Committee of SCPD, and the Registrar, focusing on potential future initiatives of SCPD. The agenda encompassed deliberations on progress activities utilizing the donated funds, the procurement of mobility aids using donated funds, and exploring opportunities for additional financial assistance and support to enhance disabled-friendly infrastructure for the students’ benefit. The meeting concluded successfully with positive discussions.

# **Fulbright Session**

March 18, 2024

The Career Guidance Unit at the University of Vavuniya organized a Fulbright Session on March 18, 2024, specifically aimed at fourth-year and third-year students of the University of Vavuniya, as well as academic staff. The session featured esteemed guests Executive Director Dr. Patrick Macnamara and Ms. Sabitha George, Student Adviser/EducationUSA, from the United States – Sri Lanka Fulbright Commission (US-SLFC).

This session provided a valuable opportunity to equip our students and academic staff with essential information about pursuing higher education in the United States. The Fulbright Commission is dedicated to offering Fulbright awards and providing EducationUSA advising services to Sri Lankan students. As part of their commitment to assisting prospective students, they conduct informational sessions covering various aspects such as U.S. university admission requirements, university/college selection, application procedures, details on standardized tests (SAT/ACT/GRE/GMAT/TOEFL), scholarship opportunities, and more.

# APPRAC – 2024

March 10, 2024

**The Asia-Pacific Peace Research Association (APPRA) Conference**

**Harmony Centre, University of Vavuniya**

The Asia-Pacific Peace Research Association (APPRA) and the Harmony Centre of the University of Vavuniya (Sri Lanka) were jointly organizing the 2024 APPRA Conference in collaboration with the Gate Institute (UK) on “Digital Transformation and Artificial Intelligence for Sustaining Peace and Democracy” from 7-10 March 2024 at the University of Vavuniya in Sri Lanka.

This conference has brought together more than 250 participants, including prominent scholars, experts, civil society activists, human rights activists and peace practitioners from different parts of the world and served as a great platform and an inspiring occasion for discussion, engagement and networking.

# Awarding Ceremony – Certificate in Russian Language

February 12, 2024

The awarding ceremony for the Certificate in Russian Language was organized on 12th of February 2024 at the University of Vavuniya.

His Excellency Mr. Levan S. Dzhagaryan, Ambassador of the Russian Federation to the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and to the Republic of Maldives, was invited as a chief guest.

His Excellency Prof. Janitha A. Liyanage, Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Russia; Prof. Kozhanov Igor Vladimirovich, Rector of Chuvash I. Yakovlev State Pedagogical University, Russia; and Madam Maria Popova, Director of the Russian House in Colombo, were invited as special guests.

Respected Vice-Chancellor Prof. T. Mangaleswaran, Director of the Cultural Centre, Mr. S. S. Suthaharan, Director of the International Division Dr. N. Raveendrakumaran, Deans of Faculties, Registrar, Bursar, and Heads of Departments were present at the event.

# **Visit of High Commissioner for Canada in Sri Lanka and Maldives to University of Vavuniya**

January 8, 2024

His Excellency Eric Walsh, High Commissioner for Canada in Sri Lanka and Maldives visited the University Vavuniya on 8th January, 2024 and had a productive discussion with our Vice-Chancellor; Professor Mangaleswaran.

Mr.Patrick Pickering , Second Secretary (Political) and Mr.G.Saahithiyanan , Political Officer from the Canadian High Commission  have also  attended this meeting. On behalf of the university, Deans of Faculties of Applied Science, Business Studies and Technological Studies, Registrar, Bursar, Heads of Departments and Directors of Centers have joined the discussion.

A productive discussion was held focusing possible collaborations with the Government of Canada and the Sri Lankan Diaspora in Canada for the development of the University of Vavuniya.

# Vavuniya University International Research Conference 2023

November 17, 2023

The Second International Research Conference of the University of Vavuniya, Vavuniya University International Research Conference 2023 (VUIRC 2023), was held on 17th November, 2023, under the theme of “Converging research scopes for liveable initiatives and paradigm shifts”. VUIRC 2023 has called for extended abstracts from research scholars under eight conference tracks.  Prof. (Dr.) S.P. Rath (Director, CSIBER, Kolhapur, India) and Dr. Nanda Nanthakumar (CEO & Chief Scientific Officer, A9 Health Inc., USA) participated as the keynote speakers in the VUIRC 2023. A panel discussion under the topic of “Role of Artificial Intelligence in Shaping the Future of Research: Transforming Academic Researchers in the Modern Era” was organized. Prof. S. Vasanthapriyan (Sabaragamuwa University of Sri Lanka), Prof. A.S. Karunananda (University of Moratuwa), Dr. S. Kirushanth (University of Vavuniya), Jothi Periasamy (University of California, Lead Instructor & Chief Data Scientist) and Dr. M. Kadirkamanathan served as the panel members. There were five technical sessions, which were conducted in hybrid mode.

# Tree Plantation – By Commercial Bank (Trees for Tomorrow)

November 11, 2023

The Commercial Bank of Ceylon embarked on an ambitious nationwide tree plantation campaign to plant 100,000 trees across with Sri Lanka with simultaneous programs in 17 Locations. The Commercial Bank in Vavuniya recently organized the tree plantation program with the tone of **“Trees for Tomorrow’’** under the one lakh tree plantation project in collaboration with the University of Vavuniya on 11th November 2023 at University premises with the participation of the **Prof. T. Mangaleswaran/ Vice Chancellor**, **Mr. R. Sivaganam/ Northern Regional Manager of the Commercial Bank, Mr. N. Rajavishahan/ Registrar**, branch managers of the Northern province and the bank staffs, University staffs and students. The event is organized by **Mr. T. Yogachandra, Manager, Commercial Bank**. Vavuniya with the Co-ordination of the **Mr. T. Raguram/ Curator (Landscape), University of Vavuniya**.

The goal of the program was to encourage environmental conservation and sustainable practices. As part of this effort, the bank donated plant saplings (50 Saplings – _Bauhinia purpurea_) and facilitated the installation of drip irrigation systems for the 100 saplings of the exist one (Palmyrah, Tabebuia spp. & Jacaranda Trees) and proposed one ( _Bauhinia purpurea_).

The program started with the bank providing a generous donation of various types of plant saplings to the university. These saplings were carefully selected to ensure a diverse range of tree species. The objective was to promote ecological balance and enhance the region’s biodiversity.

Additionally, the bank supported the university by funding the installation of drip irrigation systems. This irrigation method ensures optimal water usage by allowing water to be directly delivered to the plant roots, reducing water wastage and promoting efficient plant growth. The bank further provided the required materials for the installation, ensuring the success of the drip irrigation project.

The tree plantation program aimed not only to create a greener environment but also to raise awareness and inspire the local community about the importance of tree conservation. By collaborating with the University of Vavuniya, the Commercial Bank demonstrated its commitment to corporate social responsibility and environmental sustainability.

Through this initiative, the bank and the university fostered a positive impact on the community, contributing to a more sustainable and healthier ecosystem.

# Badminton Courts and Basketball Court Opening Ceremony

October 31, 2023

Vavuniya University’s new basketball court and renovated badminton courts were inaugurated on 31st October 2023. The chief guest was Prof. T. Mangaleswaran (Vice Chancellor of Vavuniya University); the guest of honour, Mr. Kushil Gunasekara (Founder and Chief Trustee of the Foundation of Goodness); and Dr. Malathi Waran (Director of Vanni Hope), who inaugurated the badminton courts, which are fully sponsored by the Vanni Hope Foundation and facilitated by the Foundation of Goodness.

The first match of the new badminton court was made by Prof. T. Mangaleswaran and Mr. Kushil Gunasekara. After the opening, exhibition matches were held by the university badminton team.

The opening of the new basketball court was done by Prof. T. Mangaleswaran (Vice Chancellor of Vavuniya University), Mr. Kushil Gunasekara (Founder and Chief Trustee of the Foundation of Goodness), Mr. Tharindu Fernando (Coach of the Sri Lankan Basketball Team), and Ms. Epciba Washington Clay (the Sri Lankan Basketball Team Member), which is sponsored by the Tonato Foundation and facilitated by the Foundation of Goodness. After the opening, the university’s basketball team held exhibition matches to play in it, and Ms. Epciba Washington Clay also participated in the match.

The Foundation of Goodness donated basketballs, badminton rackets, shuttlecocks and some books to the University of Vavuniya, and they were received by Prof. T. Mangaleswaran and university staff.

# Tree Plantation with Tube Well and Solar-Powered Drip Irrigation System

October 3, 2023

We extend our heartfelt gratitude to Mr. K. Uthayakumar, the esteemed proprietor of Uthayan Agro Services (Pvt) Ltd., situated on 1st Cross Street, Vavuniya. We sincerely appreciate their generous donation consisting of 188 Pongam oil trees and 22 Christina plants, as well as their installation of a tube well and solar-powered drip irrigation system. This initiative involves the plantation and irrigation along a distance of approximately 1.4 kilometres, spanning from Gate 1 to Gate 4 on the premises side of the Vavuniya to Mannar Road.

We are implementing this donation project as part of our ‘Development of Landscape and Green Environment Programme’, and the tree plantation, as well as the handing over of the installed tube well and solar panel, took place on 3rd October 2023.

During this event, the esteemed donor personally handed over the completed solar-powered drip irrigation system to Prof. T. Mangaleswaran, Vice Chancellor, University of Vavuniya, and academic, executive and non-academic staff took part in this event.

# Fourth Faculty Annual Research Session – FARS 2023

October 23, 2023

The fourth Faculty Annual Research Session (FARS 2023) of the Faculty of Applied Science, University of Vavuniya, Sri Lanka, was held on October 25, 2023, on the theme “Exploring Science Innovations for Global Well-being”. The FARS 2023 called for extended abstract submissions on five tracks from academics and research scholars, postgraduate and undergraduate students. The Annual Student Research Congress (ASRC2023) has also been conducted as a part of FARS2023. Undergraduates from Sri Lankan universities are encouraged to contribute to ASRC2023 by submitting their research works in the form of abstracts and posters. Prof. Raman Sukumar (Professor, Centre for Ecological Sciences, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore 560012, India) and Prof. M. Siyamalan (Professor, Department of Computer Science, Faculty of Science, University of Jaffna) have participated as the keynote speakers in the FARS2023. Under FARS2023, there were 2 technical sessions, which were conducted through Zoom, and a poster session, which was conducted physically.  Dr. T. Ketheesan, Faculty of Technology, University of Jaffna, and Dr. K. Kannan, Faculty of Science, University of Jaffna, chaired Technical Session 1, and Dr. Dushan Kumarathunge, Faculty of Agriculture, University of Ruhuna, and Dr. G. Abhiram, Faculty of Animal Science and Export Agriculture, Uwa Wellassa University, chaired Technical Session 2.

Prof. T. Mangaleswarn, Vice Chancellor, University of Vavuniya, participated as a Chief Guest. Also present were the Deans of the Faculties, Registrar, Bursar, Heads of the Departments, Directors of the Centres, Professors, Senior Academics, Academics, Executive Staff, staff of the university and the final-year students of the Faculty of Applied Science, who took part of this event.

# Gym Opening

September 20, 2023

The Foundation of Goodness renovated the gym of the University of Vavuniya with new equipment with the help of the Tanoto Foundation and Mr. Pradeep Karunagaran. The Chief Guest, Prof. T. Mangaleswaran (Vice Chancellor, University of Vavuniya), and the Guest of Honour, Mr. Kushil Gunasekera (Founder & Chief Trustee of the Foundation of Goodness), together inaugurated the Gym on 20th September 2023, at 10.30 a.m. for the use of university students and staff.

At the same time, the Foundation of Goodness has arranged for an instructor to provide service as a gym instructor at the University of Vavuniya.

# The Awareness Workshop on Disabilities

October 6, 2023

The Support Centre for Persons with Disabilities conducted the 02nd “Awareness Workshop on Disabilities” for Selected students from Faculty of Technological Studies, and 36 students participated in this workshop. It was conducted from 1.30pm to 03.30pm

The purpose of the workshop is to provide awareness regarding the objective and activities of the support centre for persons with disabilities at our university and how to integrate differently abled persons at our university in the future.

**Resource persons**

- Dr M. Malaravan – Consultant Eye Surgeon, Teaching Hospital, Jaffna
- Dr.Jennifer George – Head of the Department of Computing, University of Goldsmiths, London
- Mr V. Subramaniyam – Member of the National Council for Persons with Disabilities.

# **Visit of the delegates from Chuvash State Pedagogical University**

September 21, 2023

The Cultural Centre of the University of Vavuniya has organized an inauguration ceremony of the Russian language course on 21st of September 2023 at the University of Vavuniya.

Vice-Chancellor Prof. T. Mangaleswaran, Doctor of Pedagogical Sciences Prof. Elena Khrisanova, Vice Rector for Academic Affairs Ms. Svetlana Ilina, Chuvash State Pedagogical University; Director, Cultural Centre, Mr. S. S. Suthaharan; Deans of Faculties; Registrar; Bursar; Librarian, Heads of Departments; staff and students of the university were present on the occasion.

# 2nd Anniversary and Harmony Day Celebration 2023

September 20, 2023

The Harmony Centre, University of Vavuniya, hosted its 2nd Anniversary and Harmony Day Celebration 2023, and it took place on the 20th of September 2023 at SH 4 Hall, University of Vavuniya, Sri Lanka. Chief Guest: Prof. T. Mangaleswaran, Vice-Chancellor of the University of Vavuniya, Special Guest: Ms. Kana Moriwaki, Peace Researcher/Advisor, Special Guest: Mr. T. Balakumar, Political Specialist at the Embassy of Japan in Sri Lanka, Guest of Honour: Deans of the faculties, Registrar, Bursar, Religious leaders attended Distinguished Guests.  The event featured a panel discussion on the topic “Nurturing Foundations for Sustainable Peace: The Pathways in Sri Lanka”. The discussion aimed to address issues related to peace and sustainability in Sri Lanka. Ms. Frances Bulathsinghala, a communication practitioner for peace building, served as the moderator for the panel discussion.

Panelists were Dr. Jeyaseelan Gnanaseelan, Head of the Department of English Language Teaching, Faculty of Business Studies, University of Vavuniya; Emeritus Prof. Ariyarathne Kaluarachchi, Former Vice-Chancellor of the University of the Visual and Performing Arts, Colombo, Sri Lanka and  Mr. Ananth Palakidnar, Senior Journalist, Former News Editor of Ceylon Today & Sunday Observer.

A newsletter was published during the event, presumably to provide information and updates about the activities and achievements of the Harmony Centre and the University of Vavuniya. The event also included a ceremony to award certificates to participants who excelled in various competitions, including poem, debate, drama, speech, best announcer, and essay competitions related to National Unity.

This celebration appears to have been a platform for promoting peace, unity, and sustainable development in Sri Lanka, with the participation of distinguished guests and insightful panel discussions on relevant topics.

# University International Sports Festival 2023, Russia

August 31, 2023

Our university badminton (men & women), basketball (women), table tennis (men & women), and volleyball (men & women) teams participated in the University International Sports Festival 2023 in Ekaterinburg, Russia, from 18th to 31st August 2023. There were 41 students and 4 officials who participated in this sports festival. This is the first time a larger number of students from one university participated in the international tournament in Sri Lankan university history.

# **Seminar on University Admissions-2023**

September 13, 2023

The Career Guidance Unit of University of Vavuniya has organized a seminar on “University Admissions 2023”, at the Soosairatnam Block, Faculty of Buisnesss Studies on September 13th, 2023. The seminar was aimed at providing valuable insights and guidance to students who are preparing for university admission in 2023.

More than 250 students who were eligible for university admission from G.C.E Advanced Level Examination 2022 have participated in the seminar. Professor. (Mrs.) Ananthini Nanthakumaran, Dr. G. Jeyaseelan, Mr. V. Senthuran, Mr.S. Hariharan and Ms. P.Rukshani were served as the resource persons. Santhiya Construction Pvt Ltd has sponsored the refreshment expenses of the Seminar.

# Occupational Career Guidance Session

August 23, 2023

A career guidance session was held on August 23, 2023, at the SH 4 Hall, Soosairatnam Block, University of Vavuniya. This session was organized to provide valuable guidance to both graduates and undergraduates who are actively seeking opportunities for foreign employment. The workshop was conducted with the generous support of YOULEAD’s Skilled and Resilient Migrant Worker’s (SRMW) project.

The Occupational Career Guidance Session was designed to address the aspirations and queries of individuals who are interested in pursuing foreign employment. With a focus on skilled and resilient migration, the session aimed to equip participants with essential information and insights into various aspects of overseas employment.

Mr.Nirosha Happuharachi, Director, Skills and Guidance, was a resource person, esteemed experts and professionals in the field of foreign employment were invited to share their insights. They provided valuable guidance on job market trends, required skills, legal aspects, cultural adaptation, and more.

The event featured interactive workshops that facilitated discussions on the challenges and opportunities related to foreign employment. Participants engaged in group activities, case studies, and discussions that encouraged active participation and learning.

The Occupational Career Guidance Session achieved its goal of providing valuable insights and guidance to aspiring individuals seeking foreign employment opportunities.

# **Visit of Director Exams, British Council**

August 22, 2023

Mr. Dominic Hudson, Director Exams of the British Council visited University of Vavuniya with a special focus on engaging with students and addressing English language challenges on 22nd August 2023. This visit aimed to foster a deeper understanding of the students’ language needs and provide valuable guidance. During this insightful interaction, the Director engaged in candid conversations with the students, enabling them to voice their concerns and difficulties related to English language proficiency.

# Vanni Walk – Zero Plastic

July 9, 2023

On July 9th, the Zeroplastic Movement organized  Sri Lanka’s largest anti-#plastic people gathering across the country, aiming to combat plastic pollution where individuals from various communities came together to make a positive impact.

This event was named as the #ZeroplasticTrail, which focuses on raising awareness about plastic pollution and its detrimental effects on the environment, particularly wildlife.

To strengthen their cause, the ZeroPlastic Club of Vavuniya University collaborated with the Hindu Buddhist Association to organize a mini walk.

During the mini walk, university volunteers and members of the community participated, walking from the University of Vavuniya’s Admin office to Vavuniya Town. Throughout the walk, they carried placards advocating for a plastic-free future and actively cleaned up the roadside, showcasing their commitment to environmental sustainability.

The students’ dedication to the cause played a significant role in the event’s success. Their genuine concern about plastic pollution and its impact on the planet demonstrated their passion for creating a cleaner and greener environment for all.

The primary goal of the #ZeroplasticTrail was to bring attention to the urgent issue of plastic pollution and inspire people to take action in their daily lives to reduce plastic usage and waste. By doing so, they hope to protect wildlife and preserve the natural beauty of Sri Lanka.

This event has been a remarkable example of how collective efforts can make a positive difference in addressing environmental challenges. The Zeroplastic Movement expresses heartfelt gratitude to everyone involved in the #ZeroplasticTrail and extends a sincere thank you to all those supporting their cause to tackle plastic pollution.

Through these proactive steps and ongoing initiatives, they strive to create a cleaner, healthier, and more sustainable future for Sri Lanka and beyond.

# Inauguration Ceremony of the Vavuniya Toastmasters Club and Gavel Club

July 12, 2023

Inauguration Ceremony of the Vavuniya Toastmasters Club and Gavel Club of University of Vavuniya. Organized by Career guidance Unit and Staff Development Centre on 12th of July 2023, at TLH1 Lecture hall, Faculty of Technology.

Both Toastmasters Clubs and Gavel Clubs are excellent places for individuals to enhance their communication skills, overcome the fear of public speaking, and gain valuable leadership experience. These clubs provide a friendly and supportive atmosphere where members can learn and grow together, regardless of their starting skill level.

# Labour Day 2023 Celebration By Mozilla Campus Club

May 1, 2023

Labour Day was celebrated on the 01st of May 2023 by the members of the Mozilla Campus Club, University of Vavuniya. The celebration was planned and executed by Mr.Krishna Prasanth, Chair, Mozilla Campus Club, UOV along with other club members M.Kishokanth, S.Ladhushaan, C.Madhushan, T.Dhanushan, M.Dishanth, K.Vithushanan, S.Mohana Prabath, Logeeshan, Kajanthan, Oveyan. We gave some refreshments to the labours in Vavuniya district as a gesture of respect and to recognize the many contributions workers have made so far. This is a memorable event in the history of the University.

# Collaboration and Policy Development for Disability

June 5, 2023

Dr. Jennifer George, Head of the Department, Goldsmiths University of London visited University of Vavuniya to develop some online resources on 5th June 2023. She discussed with a subject expert who has knowledge and access to pull together the correct resources that already exist and develop what doesn’t exist. Her initial thoughts are to create resources and to understand the various disabilities from sensory to learning difficulties, then look at how technology can be used to support them in the learning context and an advanced version to be how to get to a place where the entire institution is disability inclusive

# Tree Planting Ceremony

June 6, 2023

Alliance Finance Company PLC donated hundred of trees and planned to donate 1000 trees  “For a Greener and a Cleaner Tomorrow”. Alliance Finance celebrated World Environmental Day on 5th June 2023 with collaborating University of Vavuniya planted tree at the University of Vavuniya.

# Holi Celebration By Mozilla Campus Club – 2023

April 30, 2023

The Holi Celebration was held on the 30st of  April 2023 at University of Vavuniya Playground, Pampaimadu. It was organized by the members of Mozilla Campus Club, University of Vavuniya. All the members of the club along with the final year students of the Department of ICT, Faculty of Technological Studies and the third year students of the Department of Physical Science, Faculty of Applied Science , University of Vavuniya participated in the celebration. It is noteworthy that this is the first time in the history of University of Vavuniya that such an event is taking place. Many fun events and games such as welcome dance, balloon dance, cap changing game took place. This initiation has helped us to build a good bond among the members as well as other faculty students in a healthy way

# **New Year Celebration – 2023**

April 29, 2023

To mark the annual celebrations of the new year for the year 2023, a grand cultural program was organized by the Harmony Centre jointy with the Students’ Union in our University premises on 29th of April 2023. University welcomed the arrival of the new year with great  passion and enthusiasm. All the students and staff were United to celebrate with joy, refreshment and entertainment.

# NCD Screening Programme- 2023

April 19, 2023

Health Centre of the University of Vavuniya had organized an NCD screening  program on 19/04/2023 for staff of the university.  92 staff were screened in this programme.

# Book Donation

March 23, 2023

Dr. M. Malaravan, Council Member, University of Vavuniya donated books (Volume I on CD and II on Hard copy) on “Legacy of the Pioneers – 125 years of Jaffna Tamils in Malaysia” to the University Library on 23rd March 2023. This book co-authored by T. Selvaratnam and S. Apputhurai , two prominent members of the community, will enable its readers to have better a better appreciation of the contributions of the Jaffna Tamil Community in Malaysia.

# An Agreement signed  with MAG to conduct English Training Programme for MAG staff  on 22nd of March 2023

March 22, 2023

The University of Vavuniya signed an agreement signed  with MAG to conduct an English Training Programme for MAG staff  on 22nd of March 2023. The officials from both parties participated in the event.  The University of Vavuniya won the tender for English Training Programme for MAG staff invited by  MAG.

1 [2](https://www.vau.ac.lk/1st-international-conference-on-harmony-and-reconciliation-19-and-20-january-2023/nggallery/page/2) [►](https://www.vau.ac.lk/1st-international-conference-on-harmony-and-reconciliation-19-and-20-january-2023/nggallery/page/2)

1. **Preamble**

The Harmony Centre, is a Centre established under the University Grant Commission Circular No 10/2021 in the University of Vavuniya, Sri Lanka in September 2021. The central purpose of the centre is to promote understanding of different religious and ethnicities while promoting the Sri Lankan sprit rather than parochial identities.  It recognizes the message of harmony and reconciliation being relevant today and the need to formulate a multi-dimensional approach to conflict resolution in alignment with the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development promoted by the United Nations, with academic cultural diversification and developing sustainable research from a global perspective. For this purpose, the objective of the **[International Conference on Harmony and Reconciliation 2023 (ICHR 2023)](https://vau.ac.lk/ichr2023/)** is to provide international and regional scholars an opportunity to:

- Reflect on the theme of harmony and reconciliation from a historical, theological, economic, social, political, educational, environmental and other perspectives
- Meet and reflect critically on the theme of harmony, peace and reconciliation.
- Make policy recommendations to faith-based organizations, non-governmental organizations (NGO), international development organizations and national organizations.
- Publish papers with discussion and conclusion.

**ICHR 2023** focuses on the theme of **“Harmony and Development through Knowledge and Innovation towards Nation Building”** providing an opportunity to review the past years and chart further directions in fostering peace and harmony based on the United Nations 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development.

Local and international research scholars, experts, artists, religious leaders, devotees and practitioners will attend the conference over the two days. Dignitaries from other countries will also be invited to attend the conference inaugural and closing sessions. The conference delegates will attend a reception and cultural events hosted by the organizers.

The schedule of conference activities has two key components: _Research sessions_ and **Harmony Exhibition**. Research sessions will rely less on paper reading and lectures, instead the format will be engaging to give deeper insights into the topic.

Following two types of research sessions will feature the conference:

- **Panel Sessions:** These sessions happening concurrently at the conference venue will provide an opportunity to multiple presenters to speak on a common theme of the conference. Presentations by the panelists will be followed by questions and answers.

- **Discussion Sessions:** These will be selected sessions designed to provide ​an in-depth look at a specific conference topic​ from one person’s research or practice. Each session will follow an interview format in which a moderator will interview an expert to explore his/her work, knowledge and personal stories. The moderator will also engage the audience in questions and comments.

Together with high quality research, the conference will host a harmony show featuring exhibition of art, poster, cartoon and craft. In this exhibition of its kind ever held in the country, local and international artists and skill persons will present the outstanding beauty of peace, harmony and reconciliation through their exhibition works and visual stories. The exhibition works will be set up at the conference venue and will be on display throughout the conference. Attendees can walk around and interact with exhibition works.

**Tracks**

01. Conflict Resolution and Peace Building
02. Social Cohesion and Reconciliation for Development
03. Communal Harmony and Social Development
04. Unity of Diversity towards Nation Building
05. Peace and Sustainable Development
06. Towards Harmony with Nature
07. Role of Art and Culture in Peace Building
08. Role of Digital Media toward Peace Building
09. **Literature for Peace**
10. **Partnership & sustainable development**

ICHR 2022 will be the forum for presentation of the research papers and its detail discussion for knowledge sharing from various countries like Inia, Pakistan, Nigeria and Sri Lanka which have been thoroughly screened by peer-reviewing. These will be presented six parallel sessions during the technical session. In addition, the program is enriched with three keynote addresses and three invited panel discussions including thirteen panelists and four moderators from Sri Lanka, USA, UK, Nepal, Slovenia and Sweden. The participants of ICHR 2023 who come from wider disciplines and professional backgrounds are expected to be enriched by the exchange of innovations. This will also be an opportunity to buildup partnerships and collaborations to advance research and a testimony to the strong research culture prevailing in the University.

# SLUSA Interuniversity Elle championship @ University of Vavuniya

January 6, 2023

The Inaugural Event of the SLUSA Interuniversity Elle championship was ceremonially inaugurated at the University of Vavuniya on 6th January, 2023 at the university playground. Fourteen Universities have participated in the championship including our university team. Vice Chancellor, Registrar, Council members, Chairman and committee members from University sports advisory board, Directors, Instructors, Coaches, delegates, referees, other invitees and the student athletes. This place is a valuable milestone in the history of the University of Vavuniya as this is the first time the university has got an opportunity to conduct the interuniversity championship. This Elle tournament lasts until 8th January, and the matches have started playing with the cheers from the Vice chancellor, University of Vavuniya.

Live Updates – **[Vanni Vogue Camera Club of Faculty of Applied Science University of Vavuniya](https://www.facebook.com/vannivogue)**

# Commencement of Work – 2023

January 2, 2023

University of Vavuniya ceremonially commenced duties of the New Year on the 2nd of January 2023, with a special function attended by Professor T. Mangaleswaran, the Vice-Chancellor along with Deans of Faculties,  Mr. N. Rajavisagan, Registrar, Bursar and all other staff members of the University. The function commenced with the hoisting of the National and University flags by the Vice Chancellor and Registrar, followed by the singing of the National Anthem. Subsequently, the Public Servants’ Oath was read by the Registrar, which was followed by the staff of the University.

Finally, The Vice-Chancellor Prof. T. Mangaleswaran delivered a short speech on the government policy and the programme introduced to overcome the present challenges and the achievements made the University of Vavuniya in the past year after upgraded as an independent university and the contribution of staff to be made in achieving the future goals of the University in order to motivate them.

# Visit of Foundation of Goodness and Australian Medical Aid Foundation

December 28, 2022

Mr. Kushil Gunasekara, Director/Founder, Foundation of Goodness and his team members and Australian Medical Aid Foundation team visited the University of Vavuniya on 28.12.2022. Foundation of Goodness sponsored Rs. 250,000/= to our 1st International Conference on Harmony and Reconciliation of the Harmony Centre, University of Vavuniya.

The Australian Medical Aid Foundation visited our Oral Health Unit to see their progress of working.

Director, Foundation of Goodness and Doctor, Australian Medical Aid Foundation take part in the tree plantation event surrounding the IT Center building area of the University during their visit. And both teams visited our playground.

# MOU with Ul.Y.Yakovlev Chuvash State Pedagogical University and South Eastern University

December 29, 2022

University of Vavuniya Signed MOU with Ul.Y.Yakovlev Chuvash State Pedagogical University and South Eastern University of Sri Lanka and Gampaha Wicramarachchi University of Indigenous Medicine on 29th December 2022. The purpose of MOU is conducting joint activities to improve the training of specialists, bachelors, masters and postgraduates.

# MOU With the Yanka Kupala State University of Grodno

December 20, 2022

**The Agreement was signed during the online meeting on the 20** **th** **of December.**

A delegation of the Embassy of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka to the Russian Federation with concurrent accreditation to the Republic of Belarus headed by the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary, Janitha Abeywickrema Liyanage and a delegation of the University of Vavuniya headed by the Vice- Chancellor, Prof. Thampoe Mangaleswaran participated in the online meeting. The delegation of Yanka Kupala State University of Grodno was headed by the Rector, Iruna Kiturka.

The meeting was productive, since both sides are interested in mutual cooperation development. The Agreement will facilitate scientific, academic and professional cooperation between partner universities and open new horizons for both parties within the framework of universities’ activities.

By the way, it is not the first meeting with the University of Vavuniya, on the 10th of July 2022 with the support of the Embassy of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka to the Russian Federation with concurrent accreditation to the Republic of Belarus a meeting with the administration of the University of Vavuniya was held. During this meeting, Sri Lankan side expressed interest in the development of academic mobility of staff and students and organization of scientific research in the following fields: biology, math, philology, tourism, economy, international law.

The University of Vavuniya is opening new faculties and specialties, and therefore the design and implementation of joint educational programs in English and Russian languages could become a promising area of mutually beneficial cooperation.

Soon a program of cooperation to the current agreement will be developed.

Link to the **Yanka Kupala State University of Grodno**

[https://en.grsu.by/en/](https://en.grsu.by/en/)

# SLASSCOM’s IT/BPM Career Fair

November 23, 2022

The IT/BPM Career Fair was organized in collaboration with University of Vavuniya and Northern Chamber of IT (NCIT).

More than 20 leading ICT / Business Operations Management companies in the country including Wiley Global Technology, CodeGen, Fortitude, VitalHub Innovations Lab, BCS Technology, SimCentric, 99X, AICPA & CIMA, Axcenz, EYEPAX and Creative Software participated in the career fair.

The IT/BPM week focused on securing jobs for IT/ICT students in institutions of higher education and created awareness among the undergraduates about the various career opportunities in the field of Communication Industry / Business Operations Management. Finally, the event created a platform with sample interviews and resume collection for the biggest career fair to be held in the Northern Province.

# University of Vavuniya Signed MOU with SLASCOM

November 23, 2022

The MOU will promote collaboration between the industry and academia, with the aim of producing skilled and future ready IT talent that will help take the industry to the next level.

The Industrial Cooperation Agreement is an important part of University’s journey of building Sri Lanka’s IT talent in tandem with IT industries to deliver the Island of Ingenuity (IOI) brand promise to local and international stakeholders, by embedding its value proposition, capabilities and competencies on students.

# The Mozilla campus club of the University of Vavuniya

November 19, 2022

The Mozilla campus club of the University of Vavuniya was inaugurated on 19th November 2022 at the Faculty of Technological Studies, University of Vavuniya.  The club was presided over by Ms.P.Amritha, Club Councilor of the Mozila Campus Club of the University of Vavuniya in the presence of the Chief Guest of the event, Vice Chancellor of the University of Vavuniya Professor T.Mangaleswaran, Special Guest of the event, Dean of the Faculty of Technological Studies, Mr.S.S.Suthaharan and the Head of the Department of Information and Communication Technology, Mr.V.Senthooran. This event was organized by the Department

of Information and Communication Technology.

The event started with the lighting of the lamp. The Department Head delivered the inaugural address. The Club Counselor of the Mozila welcomed the gathering and Chief Guest. The Chief Guest and Special Guest delivered the special address. The logo for the club and the website was launched by the Dean of the Faculty and IEEE Branch Counselor of the University of Vavuniya, Ms.P.Shorubiga respectively. The chief guest gave a special note on Mozilla campus club activities.  After which the office bearers of the club were elected among the 3rd Year ICT students and First Chair of the Mozila Campus Club of the University of Vavuniya Mr.Krishnaprasanth  introduced the club members with their roles and responsibilities.  The Dean of the Faculty and Head of the Department distributed Mozilla swags to the Chief Guest.

# Congratulations and best wishes to Mr. Krishna Prasanth – Green Asian Voice

November 20, 2022

Congratulations and best wishes to **Mr. Krishna Prasanth**, Level 3 student, from the Faculty of Technological Studies, University of Vavuniya, for being selected as the First volunteer of a project under the theme of “Youth-run Organization on leadership development “of **Green Asian Voice Council**, New Delhi, India, in Association with AIESEC, Sri Lanka. He has worked as a volunteer (Front-end Developer & Environmental volunteer) for 3 months and he acquired lot of experiences from this project and earned the internship opportunity also.

Green Asian Voice Council, an international non-profit Organization intends to create an unpolluted, clean and healthy green environment by promoting all possible measures to reduce poisonous Carbon emissions and thereby finding a remedy for the most unfortunate drastic effects of air pollution.

The mission of the council is to create awareness about this global disaster and introduce all new measures to overcome this herculean task by implementing projects that replace maximum diesel and petrol vehicles to electric vehicles, coal firing power plants to solar thermal power plants, burning of agricultural waste to latest machineries without burning and much more activities for reducing air pollution in all possible sectors.

Green Asian Voice Council Promotes Electric Vehicles, the stage is fully set to replace the millions of diesel and petrol vehicles especially the online cabs and three wheelers to electric vehicles which will be the real initial initiative for the multiplication of electric vehicles.

Green Asia Voice Council invited prestigious volunteers from 120 countries on becoming a part of Green Revolution Movement. Green Asia Voice Council is ready to support the University to inaugurate the Green Asian Voice organization in the university of Vavuniya.

# Vavuniya Journal of Science launching

November 2, 2022

The first issue of volume 01 of Vavuniya Journal of Science was ceremonially launched on November 02, 2022, at the silver jubilee celebration of the Faculty of Applied Science, University of the Vavuniya. The Vice-Chancellor of the University of Vavuniya, Dean of the Faculty of Applied Science, Dean of the Faculty of Business Studies, Dean of the Faculty of Technological Studies, Registrar, and Acting Librarian received the first copy of the Vavuniya Journal of Science.

To view the Vavuniya Journal of Science, please visit [https://vau.ac.lk/vjs/](https://vau.ac.lk/vjs/)

# The third Faculty Annual Research Session

November 3, 2022

The third Faculty Annual Research Session (FARS 2022) of the Faculty of Applied Science, University of Vavuniya, Sri Lanka was held on November 03, 2022. The theme of FARS2022 was “A gateway towards Modern Science”. The FARS 2022 called for extended abstracts submissions from academics and research scholars, postgraduate and undergraduate students.

The second Annual Student Research Congress (ASRC2022) has also conducted as a part of FARS2022. ASRC2022 was funded by AHEAD ELTA-ELSE, Faculty Development Project, Faculty of Applied Science, University of Vavuniya.  Undergraduates from Sri Lankan universities are encouraged to contribute to ASRC2022 by submitting their research works in the form of abstracts and posters. For FARS2022 and ASRC2022 research outcomes either in the form of extended abstracts or abstracts were called under following tracks:

- Track 1: Agriculture, Forestry and Biodiversity
- Track 2: Computer Science and Information Technology
- Track 3: Environmental Science and Climate change
- Track 4: Mathematics and Statistics
- Track 5: Natural Sciences
- Track 6: Software Engineering and Information systems

Prof. Terrence Madhujith, Chair Professor of Food Science and Technology from University of Peradeniya and Dr. Sivananthan Sarasanandarajah, Senior Scientist, Peter Mac Callum Cancer & Research Institute, Australia Adjunct Senior Lecturer, Monash University, Australia were served as the keynote speakers for FARS2022.

Inauguration ceremony of FARS2022 and Poster session of ASRC2022 were held in person. For the oral presentations, pre-recorded presentations were obtained from authors and the technical sessions were conducted via zoom (Presentations and Q&A session).

# Visit of British High Commissioner

October 4, 2022

The  British High Commissioner, HE Sarah Hulton visited  University of Vavuniya on 4th  October, Tuesday and had  a discussion on university development matters  with the Acting Vice-Chancellor, Deans of Faculties, Registrar and Directors/ Coordinators of Centres/ Units.

# HARMONY DAY CELEBRATION – 2022-Island wide Art, Poster & Cartoon Competition

September 26, 2022

The Harmony Centre of the University of Vavuniya, Sri Lanka planned to conduct  its harmony day program which is scheduled to be held on 26th September 2022 at the University. Also, it is hoping to organize all island Art, Poster and Cartoon Competitions among the schools’ children, teachers (Government, International & Pre School), university students, higher educational students, professionals and others from any organizations.

# Road Race

August 27, 2022

**Road race – 2022**

The Physical Education Unit, University of Vavuniya, conducted the road race event to celebrate the first anniversary of the University of Vavuniya on 27th August 2022. It started at the University of Vavuniya park premises and finished at the Pampaimadu premises of the University of Vavuniya.

Dr.T.Mangaleswaran, Vice-chancellor University of Vavuniya, participated as a chief guest in this event. Dr. M.Malaravan (Council member and Sports Advisory board member) of the University of Vavuniya participated as a special guest. Dr. Wijeyamohan (Acting Dean/ Faculty of Applied Science), Dr.Y.Nanthagoban (Dean /Faculty of Business Studies), Mr.D.S.S.Suthaharan (Dean/Faculty of Technological Studies), Mr.S.Santhirakumar Kannan (Chairman, Tamil virudsam) had participated as guests of honor in the awarding ceremony.

The winners are

|     |     |     |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **Place** | **Men** | **Women** |
| 1st Place | Mr. J. Mithurshan | Ms. S. Hemapriya |
| 2nd Place | Mr. G. Kanakaratnam | Ms. L. Kiriyalini |
| 3rd Place | Mr. F.X. Nilshan | Ms. J. Thanusiya |

# Workshop for Elle Umpires

March 12, 2022

The Physical Education Unit of the University of Vavuniya had conducted a workshop for Elle Umpires in Tamil medium in collaboration with the Northern Province Elle Association under the guidance of the Sri Lanka National Elle Association during 12th and 13th of March 2022 from 9.00 am to 4.30 pm in the Faculty of Business Studies Lecture Hall and the University Playground. This workshop was the first Tamil medium workshop in Sri Lanka for Elle umpires.

[Click here for more details](https://vau.ac.lk/peu/workshop-for-elle-umpires-held-on-march-12-13-2022/)

# Booster Vaccination (3rd Dose)

December 20, 2021

![](https://vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/University-of-Vavuniya-Logo-300x300.png)

**Notice**

**Booster Vaccination for the staff of the University of Vavuniya against**

**COVID -19**

Booster Vaccination (3rd dose) can be obtained from the MOH office Vavuniya from Monday to Friday (8.00 am to 12.00 noon). Those who had already received two vaccines against Covid-19 and completed 3months from the date of 2nd dose are eligible for Booster vaccine.

The staff of the University of Vavuniya who are eligible to obtain Booster Vaccination are requested to visit MOH office, Vavuniya with their Vaccination Card, Staff Identity Card and National Identity Card.

Vice Chancellor,

University of Vavuniya.

18.12.2021

**[Notice](https://vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/3rd-Vaccine.pdf)**

# English Enhancement Free Seminar for Advanced Level Students

January 4, 2025

The English Enhancement Seminar for Advanced Level students-2024 took place on **4th January 2025** from **8:30 am to 1:30 pm** at **SH 4, Faculty of Business Studies (FBS), University of Vavuniya (UOV)**. Organized by the Department of English Language Teaching (DELT), the seminar aimed to enhance students’ English language skills, with a special focus on writing and speaking, while also promoting the university’s academic programs and offerings.

The event was **coordinated and headed by Mr. A. Sebarajah**, Instructor in English G ii, who opened the seminar with a welcoming address that highlighted the purpose and goals of the initiative. The Vice-Chancellor of the university, **Prof. A. Atputharajah**, delivered an inspiring speech, emphasizing the importance of mastering English and IT for future empowerment. The **Dean of the Faculty of Business Studies, Prof. Y. Nanthagopan**, provided insightful remarks on the value of English in academic and professional contexts. Additionally, **Prof. G. Jeyaseelan, Head/DELT**, spoke about the challenges students face in learning English and provided guidance on overcoming them.

During the program, attendees were introduced to key academic offerings of the University:

- **IT Courses** by **Mr. N. Edwin Linosh**, former Director of ICT, UOV.
- **Higher Diploma in English** by **Ms. P. Sarmatha**, the Course Coordinator.
- **Certificate in Professional English Course** by **Mr. A. Sebarajah, the C** ourse Coordinator.

The English enhancement session featured **Prof. G. Jeyaseelan**, **Ms. P. Sarmatha**, **Mr. A. Sebarajah**, and **Mr. S. Douglus**, all serving as resource persons and delivering interactive sessions aimed at developing participants’ writing and speaking abilities. Approximately **40 students** participated in the seminar and provided overwhelmingly positive feedback, expressing appreciation for the engaging and informative sessions.

This initiative reflects the university’s commitment to academic excellence and student development. By focusing on essential communication skills, the seminar contributed significantly to participants’ academic and personal growth, further supporting their future educational endeavours.

# University of Vavuniya Staff Swimming Session

November 20, 2024

Guided by the Vice Chancellor, Physical Education Unit organized Free swimming session for University Staff on 20 November 2024 at Omanthai sports complex from 4.00pm to 6.00pm. The sections of Administration, Faculty of Applied Science, Faculty of Technological Studies, Faculty of Business Studies, and Physical Education unit had a total of 13 Male and 3 Female staff members involved in this swimming session. Propose the introduction of free-swimming sessions for university staff, an initiative that aim was to promote health, wellness, and community engagement within our university Staffs. This opportunity not only promotes health and wellness among us but also fosters a sense of community and camaraderie within our university. The chance to engage in a refreshing activity helps us alleviate stress and recharge, enabling us to perform our duties more effectively in the workplace

# World Entrepreneurs Day -2024

August 25, 2024

On August 25th, 2024, the University of Vavuniya, through its ESBM External Studies Students, successfully hosted an event to commemorate World Entrepreneurs’ Day-2024 under the direction of Mr. P. Sasitharan, Program Coordinator for ESBM External Studies. Held at the university premises on Park Road, Vavuniya, the event brought together a diverse group of participants, including students, entrepreneurs, industry professionals, and government representatives, all united by a shared interest in celebrating and advancing entrepreneurship.

The event was graced by the presence of key figures, including Professor A. Atputharajah, Vice Chancellor of the University of Vavuniya, Professor Y. Nanthagopan, Dean of the Faculty of Business Studies, Dr. (Ms) R. Malathy, Director of the University Business Linkage (UBL) Office, and Ms. S. Mathivathany, Head of the Department of Project Management. The Chief Guest, Mr. Kandaija Baskaran, Chairman of Group IBC and Reesha Organic Farm, along with the Special Guest, Mr. Shanmugarajah Sujan, President of the Vavuniya Traders Association, further elevated the significance of the event. The event also saw the participation of many leading entrepreneurs and heads of related government departments.

The event featured a series of engaging activities, including two panel discussions on the “Role of Business Incubators and Entrepreneurs in Regional and National Development” and the “Role of Modern Technologies and Professional Education in the Development of Entrepreneurship.” Additionally, participants had the opportunity to share experiences, explore a mini-industrial expo showcasing the products and services of over 45 entrepreneurs, and witness the honoring of leading entrepreneurs for their contributions.

With 150 entrepreneurs and 25 distinguished guests in attendance, the event successfully achieved its key objectives of fostering connections among entrepreneurs, promoting their products and services, and recognizing their unwavering commitment to the entrepreneurial spirit. The full-day event was a resounding success, underscoring the University of Vavuniya’s commitment to nurturing and supporting entrepreneurship in the region.

# Orientation Programme  – Advanced Certificate in Media Literacy and Journalism

May 28, 2023

Advanced Certificate Course in Media Literacy and Journalism of the Harmony Centre, UOV officially inaugurated on 28th of May 2023 at the University Premises, Park Road, Vavuniya Town under the Director, Harmony Center, UOV.  Prof. T. Mangaleswaran, the Vice Chancellor of the University, attended as the Chief Guest, and Mr. J. Yograj, a Media Consultant (SLRC), Dr. S. Senthan, the Co-Director of the UK’s Centre for Media and Human Rights, and Mr. N. Kabilnath, a Senior Media Journalist from the Vavuniya District attended as Special Guests.

# Students of Vaazhvaham visited to the Support Center for Persons with Disabilities

September 28, 2022

On 28.09.2022 Jaffna Vaazhvaham Team of 35 people including President, Vice President, Secretary, Treasurer and students of Vaazhvaham visited to the Support Center for Persons with Disabilities (SCPD), University of Vavuniya.

Prof.T.Mangaleshwarn, Vice-Chancellor gave brief introduction about the objective of establishment of the SCPD. and Ms.P.Godwin Phillip, Director/SCPD presented about the SCPD and current activities of the center. The action plan of SCPD was explained by the V.Supramanium, coordinator, SCPD. Then Both team members discussed related to future collaboration and activities focusing visual disability students and staff.

Two school students from Vavuniya were selected by vaazhvaham for free spectacles and it was issued by vice chancellor, university of Vavuniya.

# Talk on Managing Stress

July 22, 2022

Professor Suresh, Department of Parasitology , University of Malay, Malaysia is visiting our University on 22nd July 2022 (tomorrow) at 7.30AM. During his visit we have planned to discuss about establishment of medical faculty at UOV and other developments. Further, he is willing to talk “Managing Stress” on 22nd July 2022 at 8.00AM to Deans, HODs, Directors, Coordinators, Academic Staff and Executive staff  and all other interested staff  physically and virtually. Our Vice-Chancellor is inviting all interested staff to this meeting. His CV is also attached for your information, Please circulate this invitation to all your staff.The zoom link is given below:

Topic: Managing Stress by Prof.Suresh Kumar from Malasia

Time: Jul 22, 2022 08:00 AM Colombo

Join Zoom Meeting

[https://learn.zoom.us/j/7143476890?pwd=eFI4bWw1ZEJRWGdJYjhqZlQxeGpCQT09](https://learn.zoom.us/j/7143476890?pwd=eFI4bWw1ZEJRWGdJYjhqZlQxeGpCQT09)

Meeting ID: 714 347 6890

Passcode: UoV@8.00Am

June 11, 2023

# 2nd Awarding Ceremony of the Centre for Distance and Continuing Education (CDCE), University of Vavuniya

June 2, 2025

**2nd Awarding Ceremony**

**Event Name:** 2nd Awarding Ceremony of the Centre for Distance and Continuing Education (CDCE), University of Vavuniya

**Date:** 18.01.2025

**Time:** 3.00 pm

**Venue:** Faculty of Technological Studies, University of Vavuniya, Pampaimadu, Vavuniya.

The Centre for Distance and Continuing Education (CDCE) of the University of Vavuniya hosted its 2nd Awarding Ceremony on 18th January 2025 to recognize the achievements of the students of the **Advanced Certificate in Sports Coaching and Physical Education Programme, Batch 1**. The ceremony was held at 3:00 PM at the Faculty of Technological Studies, University of Vavuniya. Although 44 students were eligible to receive their certificates, 36 students attended the event to be honoured for their academic accomplishments. The ceremony was celebrated by distinguished guests including Prof. A. Atputharajah (Vice Chancellor of the University of Vavuniya), Mr N. Rajavisahan (Registrar of the University of Vavuniya), Mr. S. A. Jude Leon (Director of the CDCE), Dr. Ms. J. Nimalan (Dean of the Faculty of Applied Science), Dr. M. Kayanan (Academic Coordinator), Prof. Kanesh Rajah (Visiting Consultant, UK), and Ms. Y. Vithushana (Assistant Registrar of the CDCE). This special occasion highlighted the university’s dedication to providing high-quality, accessible education and supporting the professional development of its students in the fields of sports coaching and physical education.

# CERTIFICATE AWARDING CEREMONY OF THE CDCE

January 16, 2025

The Centre for Distance and Continuing Education (CDCE) of the University of Vavuniya organized its 1st Certificates Awarding Ceremony on 30th June, 2024 (Sunday) at 9.00am at the Faculty of Technological Studies.. Seventy students, who successfully completed their Certificates and Advanced Certificate courses, have been awarded on this day. The relevant particulars are as follows;

Certificate in Entrepreneurship and Small Business Management  –  24 students

Advanced Certificate in Women Empowerment in Politics  –  18 Students

Advanced Certificate in Media Literacy and Journalism  –  28 Students

The ceremony procession was started from the main Round About of the University of Vavuniya, Pambaimadu Premises. The Vice Chancellor, Council members, Deans of Faculties, Director, Deputy Registrars, Academic Coordinators, Course Coordinators, Resource Persons, and the students have participated in this procession. Parents and current students were also invited to takepart in this ceremony.

The Vice-Chancellor of the University of Vavuniya, Professor. Thambu Managaleswaran reading cards and awarded the certificates and advanced certificates. The Director of the CDCE, Mr.S.A.Jude Leon and the Director of the Harmony Centre, Mrs.Mathivathani Sasitharan read out the names of the awardees.

# Inauguration Ceremony of the Advanced Certificate Media Literacy and Journalism – Batch – I

May 23, 2023

The Inauguration Ceremony of the Advanced Certificate Media Literacy and Journalism – Batch – I held on 28th May 2023 at 9:00 AM at the CDCE, University of Vavuniya, Park Road, Vavuniya. This event marks the launch of an advanced program designed to equip participants with critical media literacy skills and in-depth knowledge of journalism practices. The ceremony will bring together students, faculty, and distinguished guests to celebrate the commencement of this educational journey, emphasizing the University’s commitment to enhancing media education and preparing students for careers in the evolving media landscape. The ceremony was honored by distinguished guests including Prof.T.Mangaleswaran (Vice Chancellor of the University of Vavuniya), Mr. S. A. Jude Leon (Director of the CDCE), Mrs.S.Mathivathany (Course Coordinator), and Mrs.T.Piranavamalar (Assistant Registrar of the CDCE). This special occasion highlighted the University’s dedication to providing high-quality, accessible education.

# Self-Evaluation Report Writing

December 17, 2025

The Staff Development Centre organised a Training programme on Self-evaluation Report Writing for Programme Review for the Academic Staff of the Faculty of Technological Studies, University of Vavuniya, on 15 November 2023, in collaboration with the Centre for Quality Assurance. Around 10 staff members participated. Dr P. Selvarajan, Prof. A. Nanthakumaran, Prof. V. Sivalogathasan, and Prof. A. Pushpanathan were invited as resource persons. Based on the Undergraduate Programme Review Manual published by the UGC, eight criteria of the Programme Review were discussed with the staff.

# Handling Plagiarism Detection Tools and Research Evaluation Metrics

The workshop was organised for the Temporary Staff and Special Degree students of the Faculty of Applied Science from 10.00 am to 3.00 pm. # Advanced Certificate in Media Literacy and Journalism (AMLJ)

December 17, 2025

## Overview of the Program

The Harmony Centre’s new curriculum for conducting the Advanced Certificate in Media Literacy and Journalism (ACMLJ), a six-month programme in Tamil and Sinhala, has been approved by the University Council and is scheduled for successful commencement. The curriculum development committee of the Harmony Centre has developed the programme for 15 credits, adhering to SLQF Level Two standards.

The identified courses hold enormous potential and merit, not only in enhancing critical thinking, creativity, and practical competencies for producing a positive peace narrative, but also in offering employment opportunities within the expanding digital media sector.

This proposed certificate course aims to provide enhanced learning opportunities for aspiring journalists, those currently in the media industry, potential future journalists, and digital media enthusiasts to strengthen their professional competencies in the fundamentals of digital media consumption. It offers a holistic understanding across a wide range of topics, including media convergence, global media standards, media ownership, digital radicalisation, media and hate speech, media ethics, critical consumption skills, digital applications, the evolving media landscape, misinformation, verification skills, disinformation, news literacy, media bias, and agenda setting.

As media polarisation and information falsehood grow, journalists must practise their profession with greater responsibility and accountability. This course is designed to improve relevant knowledge and practical skills while offering training for journalists and civil society members, thereby enhancing career prospects, accessibility to further education, and professional development. A full description of the curriculum and examination structure can be found on the Harmony Centre’s website.

## Call for Applications

The Harmony Centre, University of Vavuniya, invites applications from suitably qualified individuals for the following courses:

- **Advanced Certificate in Media Literacy and Journalism (ACMLJ)** – Six-month program in Tamil medium
- **Advanced Certificate in Media Literacy and Journalism (ACMLJ)** – Six-month program in Sinhala medium

These programmes are conducted during weekends and holidays and correspond to SLQF Level Two.

# Advanced Certificate in Empowering Women in Politics (ACEWP)

December 17, 2025

## Overview of the Program

The Harmony Centre’s new curriculum for conducting the Advanced Certificate in Empowering Women in Politics, a six-month programme in Tamil and Sinhala, is approved by the University Council and planned to successfully commence. The curriculum development committee of the Harmony Centre prepared the curriculum for 15 credits according to the SLQF standards for Level two.

The programme’s main focus is to develop the competencies of women by empowering and building capacity in politics, with the aim of improving the relevant knowledge and skills and providing training for women who are aspiring to get involved energetically in politics and decision-making processes. Therefore, the women’s main focus on a career in politics and decision-making organisations is two-fold: acquiring competency in politics and development planning and management, and acquiring competency in the disciplines of Empowerment, Leadership, Democracy and Governance. The aim of this programme is “to provide women with a wide range of knowledge and ability to effectively manage development programmes with good governance in politics”.

The country requires more professional women in the fields of rural, urban, regional, and national development. This Advanced Certificate in Empowering Women in Politics (ACEWP) will increase the employability of women in educational organisations and communities. The certificate-holding women will have high opportunities to find jobs or promote the employed with sufficient competing skills. A detailed description of the curriculum and examination structure for the certificate course is on the Website of the Harmony Centre.

## Call for Applications

The Harmony Centre, University of Vavuniya, invites applications from suitably qualified individuals for the following courses:

- **Advanced Certificate in Media Literacy and Journalism (ACMLJ)** – Six-month program in Tamil medium
- **Advanced Certificate in Media Literacy and Journalism (ACMLJ)** – Six-month program in Sinhala medium

These programmes are conducted during weekends and holidays and correspond to SLQF Level Two.

# Workshop on “Problem Identification for a research Proposal” (Harmony and Reconciliation)

**Participation:** Probationary and Temporary Lecturers from the faculty of Business Studies

The Harmony Centre of the University of Vavuniya conducted a workshop on “ **Problem Identification for a research Proposal**(Harmony and Reconciliation)” for Probationary and Temporary Lecturers from the faculty of Business Studies of the University of Vavuniya on 8th June 2022 at 3.00 pm (Sri Lankan Time) at BH 4, Faculty of Business Studies. Ms. M .Prarthana Madhuwanthi, Member, Education, Research and Training Committee, Harmony Centre, and Consultant for Research and Training, World University Friends, Peradeniya, Sri Lanka, was the resource person for this workshop.

Prarthana Madhuwanthi – Member, Education, Research and Training Committee, Harmony Centre and Consultant for Research and Training, World University Friends, Peradeniya, Sri Lanka – was the resource person for this workshop.

**Workshop on “How to Create an Online Platform to the Harmony Centre Social Reconciliation Centres”**

**T** he Harmony Centre of the University of Vavuniya conducted a workshop on “How to Create an Online Platform for the Harmony Centre/Social Reconciliation Centres” for members of the Management Committee, Harmony Centre, and Social Reconciliation Centres & UGC Standing Committee on Social Reconciliation via the Zoom platform on Aug 31, 2022, from 10:00 AM to 11:30 AM. Ms. Prarthana Mathuwanthi – Member, Education, Research and Training Committee, Harmony Centre and Consultant, Research and Training, World University Friends, Peradeniya, Sri Lanka – was the resource person for this workshop. She has discussed the meaning of online platforms, tools and apps for the online platform, handling mechanisms, data updating and monitoring mechanisms for sharing the information and creating better networks with individuals, team members, stakeholders, institutions and other organisations.

# Webinar

December 17, 2025

![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/image-3.png)

On Tuesday, December 14, 2021, at 7 p.m. (Sri Lankan Time), the Harmony Centre of the University of Vavuniya hosted a webinar for undergraduate students and public officials, with 110 participants. The Easter Attack Survivors Project’s co-founder, Ms Aamina Muhsin, has been asked to appear as a guest speaker on the topic of “Voices of Victims and the Road to Reconciliation”. The participants have a tremendous opportunity to share their understanding of community peace and the value of reconciliation thanks to this informative webinar.

![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/image-4.png)

On December 26, 2021, at 3 p.m. (Sri Lankan Time), the Harmony Center of the University of Vavuniya, the Project Management Club of the Department of Project Management, and Friendly ASIA hosted a webinar on National Safety Day 2021 for undergraduate students and public servants. More than 150 people participated. Both Ms. Anoja Seneviratne, Director, Mitigation, Research and Development Division, DMC, and Professor Dilanthi Amarathunga, Professor of Disaster Risk Reduction and Management, Head, Global Disaster Resilience Centre, have been asked to participate as the guest speakers. Guest speakers have given presentations on the topics of Risk-Informed Decision Making on Development Agenda in Pandemic Crisis and Mainstreaming DRR in Development Projects in Sri Lanka, respectively.

![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/image-5.png)

On January 3, 2022, at 6 p.m. (Sri Lankan Time), the World University Friends (WUF) and the Harmony Center of the University of Vavuniya held a webinar for undergraduate students and public servants on the topic of Going Beyond Territories of the Identities to Create a Harmonious World Toward Social Reconciliation. Dr. Kuma Iddamallena, a master trainer in NLP and MMVT as well as a personality and leadership training specialist, has been asked to appear as a guest speaker.

![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/image-6.png)

The University of Vavuniya’s Harmony Centre held its fourth webinar, Rebuilding the Communities Through Harmony Centre, for staff, students, government employees, and community members on February 28, 2022, at 3 p.m. For this virtual session, guest speakers Nahdiya Nasoordeen Danish, LLB (London), Attorney-at-Law (Sri Lanka), and MHRD (AP-COL) have been invited. The introduction and welcoming speeches for this webinar were given by Mrs. S. Mathivathany, Director, Harmony Centre. Additionally, Prof. T. Mangaleswaran, vice chancellor, made a special presentation and supported the Harmony Centre’s initiatives. She spoke on fostering peace and unity through a participatory approach, harmony, and reconciliation, as well as fostering discourse, developing capacity, learning new languages, uniting diverse religious communities, including children and youth, and encouraging unity through diversity.

# Opening ceremony of the Centre for Russian Language and Culture at University of Vavuniya

March 15, 2023

University of Vavuniya with the collaboration of the UI.Y.Yakovlev Chuvash State Pedagogical University, Russia opened a Centre for Russian Language and Culture at the University of Vavuniya. The Centre was ceremonially opened on 15.03.2023 at 9 am in the presence of the following delegates from Russia: Prof. Vladimir Nikolaevich Ivanov, Acting Rector, Ed.D., Senior Lecturer Igor Vladimirovich Kozhanav, Vice Rector for Scientific and Innovative work, Ed.D. And Mr. Alexander Alekseevich Kirillov, Head of the Department of for Scientific and Innovative work. Photographs: Vanni Vogue Club.

# Opening ceremony of the Cultural Centre

September 6, 2023

The Cultural Centre of the University of Vavuniya has organized an opening ceremony of the Cultural Centre on the Second floor of the Library on 06.09.2023. The celebration was associated with the 2nd anniversary of the University of Vavuniya in the Lecture hall of the Faculty of Technological Studies.

Vice-Chancellor Prof. T. Mangaleswaran, Honorable Consul General of India, Jaffna, Shri Raakesh Natraj, Honorable Head of Chancery and Commercial Representative, Shri V. Ram Mahesh, Director, Cultural Centre, Mr. S. S. Suthaharan,  Deans of Faculties, Registrar, Bursar, Librarian, Heads of Departments, all staff of the university were present in the occasion.

To mark the Second anniversary of the University, schools students were invited from various schools for the awarding ceremony of the chess competition conducted by the University of Vavuniya.

# Visit of Prof. Ankuran Dutta, Director, Swami Vivekananda Cultural Centre

August 24, 2023

Prof. Ankuran Dutta, Director, Swami Vivekananda Cultural Centre, High Commission of India, Colombo, has visited the University of Vavuniya on 24th August 2023.

Vice-Chancellor Prof. T. Mangaleswaran, Director, Cultural Centre, Mr. S. S. Suthaharan,  Council Member, Dr. M. Malaravan, Deans of Faculties, Registrar, Bursar, and Heads of Departments were present in the event. A fruitful discussion took place with Prof. Ankuran Dutta regarding the progression and future cultural development of the University of Vavuniya.

# Viksit Bharat Run 2025

September 28, 2025

University of Vavuniya actively participated in the Viksit Bharat Run 2025, organized by the Consulate General of India in Jaffna on Sunday, 28th September 2025. A spirited team of ten enthusiastic runners—A.Jacob, M.Thilagan, S.Sujith, S.Manoj, Sriharan, Kajeevan, Dilrukshan, Thakshan, Achini, and Gowshiya—represented our university with remarkable energy, determination, and team spirit. The event saw over 70 participants gather at the Jaffna Thiruvalluvar Cultural Centre, embarking on a vibrant run through the heart of the city.

Along the route, runners passed iconic landmarks including the Jaffna Public Library, Duraiappa Stadium, Jaffna Fort, and Pannai Bridge, making the experience both memorable and meaningful.

![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/10/Viksit-Bharat-Run-2025-3-1024x629.jpeg)

# EM Jeevan Trophy 2025 – Group B Football Final

August 19, 2025

Vavuniya University Crushes Maruthanila with a 4–0 Victory

The EM Jeevan Trophy 2025 continued to deliver electrifying football as the Group B final took centre stage on 17.08.2025 at the Young Star Grounds. The atmosphere was charged with excitement as Vavuniya University clashed with the spirited Vavuniya Maruthanila Sports Club, both teams vying for supremacy and a spot in the next phase of the competition. From the opening whistle, Vavuniya University stamped its authority on the game. Their players showcased sharp passing, intelligent movement, and relentless pressure that left Maruthanila struggling to find rhythm. The midfield maestros dictated the pace, while the forwards wasted no time in testing the opposition goalkeeper.

The first half set the tone, with the university side breaking through the defence with precision. Their clinical finishing stunned the Maruthanila backline, leaving the crowd roaring with every strike. As the game wore on, the dominance only grew stronger.

In the second half, Vavuniya University turned the match into a showcase of attacking brilliance. Wave after wave of well-coordinated moves overwhelmed Maruthanila, who were unable to contain the pace and creativity of their opponents. By the final whistle, the scoreboard read 4–0, a convincing statement of intent from the university side.

This emphatic victory was more than just three points—it was a declaration. Vavuniya University has emerged as a powerhouse in Group B, blending youthful energy with tactical maturity. Their flawless display has now raised expectations as they advance into the EM Jeevan Trophy 2025.

For the fans, it was a day to remember. For the players, it was a performance to build upon. And for their rivals, it was a clear warning: Vavuniya University is here to dominate

![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/Football-1-1-1024x614.jpeg)
