# Carrom Friendly match with University of Vavuniya vs Wayamba University of Sri Lanka

August 24, 2025

Wayamba University of Sri Lanka invited the University of Vavuniya to participate in a friendly carrom match held on 24th August 2025 at the Wayamba University premises. Twelve carrom players from the University of Vavuniya were selected to represent the university in this event, which served as a valuable practice opportunity ahead of the Sri Lanka University Games 2025.

The match was organised to foster sportsmanship, strengthen inter-university relationships, and help players gain competitive experience. During the event, both universities played two matches, with each team securing one win, resulting in a 1–1 draw. The matches were played in a spirited and friendly atmosphere, allowing participants to showcase their skills, teamwork, and strategic thinking. Overall, the event was a meaningful step in preparing for the upcoming university games and highlighted the enthusiasm and talent of student athletes from both universities.

![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/WhatsApp-Image-2025-08-25-at-9.41.48-AM-1024x768.jpeg)

# Inter-University Invitational Women’s Elle Championship 2025

August 19, 2025

The Physical Education Unit of the University of Vavuniya successfully organised the Inter-University Women’s Elle Championship on 15th August 2025 at the University of Vavuniya grounds.

The tournament brought together three universities: Eastern University, Sri Lanka; Rajarata University of Sri Lanka; and the University of Vavuniya. After a series of highly competitive matches, Eastern University, Sri Lanka, emerged as the overall champions, securing the prestigious trophy. Rajarata University of Sri Lanka claimed second place, while the University of Vavuniya, as the host, showcased a commendable performance and exemplary sportsmanship.

The event was graced by the distinguished presence of the Vice-Chancellor of the University of Vavuniya, Senior Professor A. Atputharajah, who attended as the Chief Guest. His participation greatly enhanced the significance of the tournament and reflected the university’s unwavering commitment to promoting sports, encouraging women’s participation in athletics, and fostering inter-university collaboration.

The Championship not only highlighted the athletic excellence of the participating universities but also served as a meaningful platform for empowering women athletes, fostering teamwork, and strengthening bonds across universities.

# Sri Lanka University Games 2025 – Rugby

July 15, 2025

The University of Vavuniya played its first match on **27th June 2025** at the **University of Peradeniya**, facing **Wayamba University of Sri Lanka**. In this match, Wayamba University scored **41 points**, while the University of Vavuniya did **not score**.

The second match was held on **5th July 2025, also at the University of Peradeniya.** where our team faced Kelaniya University of Sri Lanka. Kelaniya University scored **91 points**, and again, the University of Vavuniya did not score.

The third match took place on **11th July 2025** at the **University of Peradeniya**, where our team faced **Southeastern University** of Sri Lanka. In this match, the **University of Vavuniya scored 55 points**, while **Southeastern University** did not score.

✌️ This was the **first-ever victory** for the University of Vavuniya in Rugby at the **Sri Lanka University Games 2025**

# University of Vavuniya Open Table Tennis Championship 2025

June 21, 2025

The students at the University of Vavuniya showcased exceptional talent and sportsmanship

during the 2025 Open Table Tennis Championship, held on the 21st and 22nd of June 2025 at the

Indoor Complex. Throughout the two-day event, both male and female students actively

participated and delivered commendable performances. Mr. L. Ram Ramanan, Bursar of the

University of Vavuniya, served as the chief guest on the first day of the competition.

This achievement reflects the university’s growing strength in sports and the unwavering

dedication of its young athletes. Congratulations to all the winners and participants for their hard

work and success.

Two days after the event, Acting Vice Chancellor Prof. Y. Nanthagoban, Bursar Mr. L. Ram

Ramanan, and Chairman of the Sports Advisory Board Mr. S. A. Jude Leon awarded prizes to

the winners.

# Friendly Cricket Match Between University of Vavuniya vs Eastern University Sri Lanka

June 30, 2025

Eastern University of Sri Lanka invited the University of Vavuniya for a friendly inter-university

cricket match on June 7, 2025, at their ground. Batting first, Vavuniya posted 140 all out in 45

overs, with Harshana (35) and Isuru (29) leading the scoring, while Eastern’s bowlers, led by

Vidarshan (3/19), kept them in check. Eastern University faced early trouble on 26/4 but

rebounded as Vara (58) and Shandu (43) built a crucial partnership, guiding their team to 144/6

in 34.3 overs and securing a four-wicket victory.

Result: Eastern University Sri Lanka won by 4 wickets.

![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/UOv-vs-Eastern-Uni.jpg)

# Friendly Cricket Match Between University of Vavuniya vs Southeastern University Sri Lanka

June 30, 2025

Southeastern University invited the University of Vavuniya for a friendly 50-over match at their

ground on 8th June 2025, where University of Vavuniya secured a thrilling 2-wicket victory.

Batting first, Southeastern posted 196 in 41.2 overs, with Yasintha top-scoring with a quick 65.

Vavuniya’s bowlers kept things tight, with Sahan and Pahan both taking three wickets.

In response, Vavuniya chased down 197 in 40.2 overs, thanks to Harshana’s fluent 51 and crucial

contributions from Ingaran and Riwaqi. South Eastern’s bowlers made it tough, but extras proved

costly, and Vavuniya held their nerve for a well-fought win.

![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/Uov-vs-South-Eastern.jpg)

# Friendly Cricket match With University of Vavuniya vs North Star Sports Club

June 30, 2025

On 21st June 2025, the University of Vavuniya hosted a friendly 50-over cricket match against

North Star Sports Club. University of Vavuniya struggled early in their innings but managed 118

runs, thanks to small partnerships and extras. North Star also faced pressure during their chase,

losing 8 wickets, but clinched the win in the 31st over with steady late batting. Tight bowling

from both teams and a high number of wide (46 in total) made the match a close and exciting

contest.

# University of Vavuniya Inter faculty Championship 2025

May 26, 2025

The Inter-Faculty Championship 2025 is scheduled to begin on 26.05.2025 at the University of

Vavuniya Playground. This much-anticipated annual sporting event brings together students from

across the university in a spirited display of athleticism, camaraderie, and healthy competition.

Mr. S. Suman Marshall of the University of Vavuniya will honor the occasion as the chief guest.

This year, students from the Faculty of Applied Science, Faculty of Business Studies, and

Faculty of Technological Studies will proudly represent their respective faculties in a range of

sporting events. The championship serves as a vibrant platform for students to showcase their

talent, foster inter-faculty unity, and promote the value of sportsmanship and teamwork within

the academic community.

# Friendly rugby encounter (University of Vavuniya vs Rajarata University of Sri Lanka)

June 30, 2025

The University of Vavuniya hosted a friendly rugby encounter against the Rajarata University of

Sri Lanka on June 8, 2025, at their home playground. The term “friendly match” typically means

that while the competition was serious, the primary goal was sportsmanship and camaraderie

rather than tournament ranking. At the end of the match, the University of Vavuniya secured a

dominant 15-0 victory over the Rajarata University of Sri Lanka.

# University of Vavuniya Open Chess Championship 2025 -“Battle of Minds”

June 14, 2025

The Physical Education Unit and the Chess Team organized an Open Chess Tournament for

current students, alumni, and staff of the University of Vavuniya on the 14th and 15th of June

2025 at the Library Building. The guest of honor was our university’s Acting Vice Chancellor,

Prof. Y. Nanthagopan. The tournament featured four different categories: Rated Category, Staff

Category, Men’s Category, and Women’s Category.

Results after matches:

### Rated Category

1. K. Vithyasagar – 1st Place
2. D.T.P. Bogahawatta – 2nd Place
3. J. Ananthitha – 3rd Place

### Staff Category

1. A. Rukshan – 1st Place
2. T. Sethurkka – 2nd Place
3. L. Ram Ramanan – 3rd Place

### Men Category

1. A. Sivabavan – 1st Place
2. V. Harson – 2nd Place
3. J. Kajeevan – 3rd Place

### Women Category

1. K. Epziba – 1st Place
2. K. Sathursha – 2nd Place
3. H.D.S.B. Subashini – 3rd Place

# Vavuniya Soccer League – 2025

June 1, 2025

Under the regulation of the Vavuniya Soccer League, the third match of the football tournament organized by the Vavuniya Sunshine Sports Club was held on 1st June 2025 at Youngstar ground. In this match, the University of Vavuniya faced off against the Kalaimagal Sports Club, Chettikulam.

It was a competitive and high-spirited encounter, with both teams displaying impressive skills and sportsmanship in the field. Despite their valiant efforts, the University of Vavuniya fell short and was narrowly defeated by a scoreline of 2–1. The players from both sides gave their best, keeping the spectators engaged and energized throughout the match.

This match marked a crucial moment in the tournament, showcasing emerging talent and the growing enthusiasm for football in the region. While the University of Vavuniya embraced defeat with grace, they have undoubtedly gained valuable experience that will strengthen their performance in future games.

![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/image.png)

# Friendly Cricket Match – Wayamba University and Police Team.

June 16, 2025

**University of Vavuniya** VS **Wayamba University of Sri Lanka**

In a friendly 50-over cricket match held on 11th May 2025 at the Wayamba University ground, Wayamba University batted first but struggled against strong bowling, getting all out for 168 runs in 36.2 overs. In response, the University of Vavuniya delivered a dominant batting performance, reaching the target comfortably in 39.2 overs while losing only one wicket.

Janith was the standout performer, scoring 79 runs off 125 balls, while Harshana provided solid support with 41 runs off 109 balls. With other batsmen contributing minimally, their partnership played a crucial role in securing victory. University of Vavuniya won convincingly by nine wickets, showcasing excellent teamwork and composure under pressure. A great display of sportsmanship from both teams.

![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/Uov-vs-Wayamba-Cricket.jpg)

**University of Vavuniya VS Police Team Vavuniya**

The friendly cricket match between the Police Team, Vavuniya, and the University of Vavuniya took place on May 25, 2025, at the University of Vavuniya playground. It was set as a 50-over match, meaning each team had the opportunity to bat for a maximum of 50 overs. The University of Vavuniya batted first, playing for 43.3 overs before being all out, having scored a total of 134 runs. This meant that they fell short of using their full quota of overs, but they still managed to set a target of 135 runs for the Police Team to chase. In response, the Police Team, Vavuniya, went into bat, needing 135 runs to win. However, they were all out after 43 overs, having scored only 127 runs. Since they fell short of the target and lost all their wickets, the University of Vavuniya won the match by 7 runs. Despite the close contest, the University of Vavuniya successfully defended their total, making for a competitive and exciting game. Both teams played with determination, but in the end, the University of Vavuniya emerged victorious.

![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/Uov-vs-Police-team-Cricket.jpg)

# “Battle of Brothers” Rugby Match

June 5, 2025

The “Battle of Brothers” rugby match, organized by the Physical Education Unit and Rugby Team of the University of Vavuniya on 24th May 2025 at the University of Vavuniya Playground, was a thrilling event that brought together current students and alumni in a spirited competition. Played with remarkable intensity, the match showcased impressive skill and teamwork from both sides, with the Present Boys securing a commanding 13-0 victory over the Old Boys. Despite the score, the Old Boys displayed resilience and experience, making the contest engaging and competitive. More than just a game, the event fostered camaraderie between past and present players, celebrated the university’s rugby legacy, and provided valuable exposure to younger athletes while strengthening alumni relations. The success of the match was a testament to the dedication of the participants, supporters, and organizers, who contributed to an event that not only upheld the university’s sporting traditions but also inspired future generations to embrace the sport.

# Memorial Netball Tournament in Honor of the Late Mrs. Puuvaneswary Loganathan – 2025

May 26, 2025

Physical Education Unit of the University of Vavuniya, organized by the netball tournament for schoolgirls under the age of 16 from the Vavuniya District was held on May 16, 2025, at the university playground.

This tournament was conducted in loving memory of the late Mrs. Puvaneswary Loganathan, Senior Lecturer and former Head of the Department of Bio-Sciences at the Faculty of Applied Sciences, University of Vavuniya, in recognition of her dedicated contributions to both academic and extracurricular development.

Four schools from the Vavuniya South Educational Zone participated in the tournament:

- V/Nelukkulam Kalaimahal Maha Vidyalayam
- V/Rambaikulam Girls’ Maha Vidyalayam
- V/Arivithottam Sivananda Vidyalayam
- V/Gamini Maha Vidyalayam

The tournament followed a round-robin format, where each team competed against every other team. This structure fostered unity, sportsmanship, and a spirit of healthy competition among the participants.

At the conclusion of the tournament, **V/Nelukkulam Kalaimahal Maha Vidyalayam emerged as the champions**, while **V/Rambaikulam Girls’ Maha Vidyalayam** secured the runner-up position, and **V/Gamini Maha Vidyalayam** claimed third place.

The event was graced by the Vice Chancellor of the University of Vavuniya, who served as the Chief Guest and delivered an inspiring speech emphasizing the role of sports in shaping discipline and empowering youth.

Mrs. Gowri Nirmalan, Dean of the Faculty of Applied Sciences, participated as the Special Guest, and Mr. Jude Leon, Chairman of the University Sports Advisory Council, attended as the Guest of Honour, adding further prestige to the event.

Faculty of Applied Sciences staff members and lecturers were also present, offering their encouragement and support to the young athletes. Their involvement highlighted the university’s dedication to promoting holistic development and sporting excellence among students.

This tournament served not only as a celebration of athletic talent but also as a heartfelt tribute to a beloved educator whose legacy continues to inspire future generations.

All sponsorships and support for the event were generously provided by the University of Vavuniya Teachers’ Association and the lecturers of the Faculty of Applied Sciences. On behalf of the Physical Education Unit, we extend our sincere thanks and appreciation to them.

# NCP Srilions 7s 2025 rugby Championship

June 16, 2025

A competitive rugby tournament featuring club teams from the Northern Province was held on 1st June 2025 at the Irappperiyakulam Army Camp Grounds. The event brought together ten rugby clubs from across the province, all vying for top honors in this regional showdown.

In a thrilling display of sportsmanship and skill, the Vavuniya University Rugby Team emerged as the runner-up, securing second place in the Bowl category after a hard-fought match.

The tournament, branded as the NCP Sri Lions 7s 2025, showcased high-caliber rugby action throughout the day.

The results were as follows:

                    •  Cup Champions: Archers RFC, Vavuniya

                    •  Cup Runners-up: Sri Lions NCP

                    •  Plate Champions: Gunners RFC, Anuradhapura

                    •  Plate Runners-up: Sri Lions Academy, Anuradhapura

                    •  Bowl Champions: Kekirawa RFC

                    •  Bowl Runners-up: Vavuniya University RFC

A standout performance came from Lesli Subashana of Archers RFC, who was named the Most Outstanding Player of the Tournament for his exceptional skill, agility, and leadership on the field.

This tournament not only fostered competitive spirit but also strengthened regional ties through sport. It highlighted the growing popularity and talent pool of rugby in the Northern Province and surrounding regions.

The Vavuniya University team’s strong performance is a testament to the dedication and discipline of its players and coaching staff. With continued support and training, they are poised for even greater success in future tournaments.

![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/NCP-Srilions-7s-2025-rugby-championship.jpg)

# Free Swimming Session for the Staff of the University of Vavuniya

August 29, 2025

A special swimming session was successfully conducted for the staff of the University of Vavuniya on the 23rd and 30th of July 2025, from 5:00 PM to 6:45 PM at the Omanthai Swimming Complex. This program was organised to promote physical fitness, relaxation, and team spirit among the university’s staff members.

A total of 12 officers, including the university registrar and assistant bursar, actively participated in the training sessions. Participants showed great enthusiasm and interest throughout. The initiative not only helped improve their swimming skills but also provided an opportunity for the staff to engage in healthy and refreshing physical activity outside their regular work routine.

The focus of these sessions was to offer a relaxing break from office work and promote overall well- being.

# Sri Lanka University Games 2025 – Cricket

July 30, 2025

The Sri Lanka University Games cricket matches were held on the 12th, 19th, and 26th of July 2025 at different universities. Our university team played against three different universities.

#### **Match 1: Vavuniya University vs Sri Jayawardenapura University**

**Date:** July 12, 2025

**Venue:** Vavuniya University Ground

**Match Summary:**

• _Sri Jayawardenapura University:_ 201 all out in 42.5 overs

• _Vavuniya University:_ 98 all out in 39.5 overs

**Result:** Sri Jayawardenapura University won by 103 runs

#### **Match 2: Vavuniya University vs Kelaniya University**

**Date:** July 19, 2025

**Venue:** University of Kelaniya

**Match Summary:**

• _Vavuniya University:_ 115 all out in 22.4 overs

• _Kelaniya University:_ 118/2 in 13.0 overs

**Result:** Kelaniya University won by 8 wickets

#### **Match 3: Vavuniya University vs Rajarata University**

**Date:** July 26, 2025

**Venue:** Rajarata University of Sri Lanka

**Match Summary:**

• _Rajarata University:_ 166 all out in 44.0 overs

• _Vavuniya University:_ 159 all out in 42.5 overs

**Result:** Rajarata University won by 7 runs

#### **Key Performances:**

• **Mohammed Riwaqi** – 6 wickets for 29 runs in 9 overs _(Player of the Match)_

# Inter University Football Championship 2024

September 29, 2024

The Inter-University Football Championships-2024 of the Sri Lankan University Games 2024 (SLUG-2024) was held from 27th to 29th September 2024, Organized by the University of Vavuniya at the University Playground with the support of the Sri Lanka Universities Sports Association (SUSA).

The tournament was ceremonially inaugurated by Prof. Arulampalam Atputharajah, the vice chancellor of the University of Vavuniya, with the presence of the registrar, Mr. N. Rajavisahan; the chairman of the Sports Advisory Board, Dr. M. Kayanan; the coordinator of physical education, Mr. R. Sivasegaran; the staff members of the University of Vavuniya; and the teams represented by the universities and their representatives.

After the successful completion of the tournament, the awarding ceremony was held on 29th September 2024 around 5.00 PM, with the presence of the Vice Chancellor of the University of Vavuniya, and the winning teams were awarded as follows:

- **Champion** – South Eastern University of Sri Lanka.
- **Runner up** – Sabaragamuwa University of Sri Lanka.
- **2nd Runner up** – Eastern University of Sri Lanka.

The tournament was successfully organized by the Physical Education Unit of the University of Vavuniya along with the support of the organizing committee and other staff members of the university.

March 3, 2024

The 11th Open I.SK.DJ International Cup was held on 2 nd & 3 rd of March 2024, at Indoor

Stadium, Anuradhapura. The tournament was organized by International Shotokan Karate Do

Japan School. Mr. T.O.R.N.Priyadarshana has represented the University of Vavuniya and

won two Silver medals in Kata and Kumite.

# Inter-University Karate Champion – 2022

December 8, 2022

The Inter-University Karate Championship was organized by the University of Colombo under the supervision of the Sri Lanka Universities Sports Association (SLUSA) on 2nd 3rd and 4th December 2022 at the Indoor Gymnasium, University of Colombo.

There were 08 students (03 male & 05 female) who represented the University of Vavuniya to the Inter-University Karate Championships.

At the Tournament, Mr. Salitha Dilshan Mendis (2020/ASB/099) of the Faculty of Applied Science, University of Vavuniya, won first place in the below 67 kg weight category of the Kumite event.

This is the first win of the University of Vavuniya at an inter-university sports tournament. It is a historical occasion to the sports at University of Vavuniya. The Physical Education Unit congratulates Mr Salitha for his performance.

# Sri Lanka University Games – 2025

October 9, 2025

Sri Lanka University Games 2025 Scheduled to be on 05th September 2025 to 21st September 2025 at Rajarata university of Sri Lanka.

## 🏸 **Badminton**

**Date:** 05th – 07th September 2025

**Venue:** Indoor Complex, Rajarata University of Sri Lanka

### **Women’s Matches**

- **First Round:** University of Jaffna triumphed with a **3–1 victory** over the University of Vavuniya.
- **Second Round:** University of Vavuniya Women’s Badminton Team secured a **remarkable 3–2 victory** against the Southeastern University of Sri Lanka.

* * *

## 🏖️ **Beach Volleyball (Men)**

**Date:** 14th – 18th September 2025

**Venue:** Playground, Rajarata University of Sri Lanka

### **Highlights**

- **Quarter Finals:** Huge congratulations to our **University of Vavuniya Men’s Beach Volleyball – Team B** for their **thrilling 2–1 victory** against the Eastern University of Sri Lanka.
- Another outstanding performance with a **2–0 win** against the University of Peradeniya.

* * *

## 🥋 **Karate**

**Date:** 15th – 16th September 2025

**Venue:** Indoor Complex, Rajarata University of Sri Lanka

### **Men’s Events**

- 🏆 **Final:** Congratulations to **S.D. Mendis**, who achieved **Second Runner-Up** in the **Men’s Karate – Kumite (Below 75kg)** category.
- **First Round:** In the Men’s Kumite (Below 84kg) category, **Sithila Gayashan** scored **6 points**, while his opponent scored **5 points** in a tight match against the University of Ruhuna.

### **Women’s Events**

- **First Round (Below 68kg):** **Chathumini Karunathilake** secured a **1–0 victory** over the University of Jaffna.
- **First Round (Below 45kg):** **Naduni Sasanka** triumphed with a **1–0 win** against the Southeastern University of Sri Lanka.

* * *

## 🏓 **Table Tennis**

**Date:** 17th – 18th September 2025

**Venue:** Indoor Complex, Rajarata University of Sri Lanka

### **Women’s Matches**

- University of Vavuniya Women’s Team recorded a **nail-biting 3–2 victory** against the University of Jaffna.

### **Men’s Matches**

- University of Vavuniya Men’s Team achieved a **thrilling 3–0 victory** over the Southeastern University of Sri Lanka.

* * *

# Battle of Brothers Cricket and Football

October 29, 2025

The University of Vavuniya Students’ Union, in collaboration with the Physical Education Unit, organized the _Battle of Brothers_ Cricket and Football matches on the 25th and 26th of October 2025 at the University Playground. Students from three faculties participated in the tournament: the Faculty of Business Studies, the Faculty of Applied Science, and the Faculty of Technological Studies.

The opening ceremony was held on 25th October 2025, with the Vice Chancellor serving as the Chief Guest of the tournament.

Preliminary cricket and football matches were held on both days between the three faculty teams. On the final day of the cricket tournament, the Faculty of Technological Studies faced off against the Faculty of Business Studies. The Faculty of Technological Studies scored 119 runs for 5 wickets in 15 overs. In response, the Faculty of Business Studies managed only 67 runs with 7 wickets down. As a result, the Faculty of Technological Studies won the cricket final.

Due to limited time, the football teams did not play a full match and proceeded directly to a penalty shootout. In the final, the Faculty of Business Studies played against the Faculty of Applied Science. The Faculty of Business Studies scored 4 goals, while the Faculty of Applied Science scored only 2 goals, securing the victory for the Faculty of Business Studies.

At the end of the tournament, trophies were distributed to the winners by the Vice Chancellor of the University of Vavuniya, Professor A. Atputharajah, along with Dr. K. Arjunan (Proctor), Mr. S. Suman (Marshal), and Mr. R. Sivasegaran (Acting Director of the Physical Education Unit).

# Friendly Cricket Encounter at the University of Vavuniya

October 29, 2025

A friendly cricket match was held today, 19th October 2025 at the university of Vavuniya Playground, between the Old Boys (alumni) and the Present Boys (current students) of the University of Vavuniya. The event aimed to strengthen the bond between past and present students through sportsmanship and friendly competition.

Batting first, the Old Boys scored 117 runs for the loss of 5 wickets in their allotted 20 overs.

            •           Namila top-scored with 33 runs (25 balls),

            •           Lilan contributed 21 runs (19 balls), and

            •           Shanaka remained unbeaten with 14 runs (15 balls).

Among the bowlers,

            •           Lahiru took 2 wickets for 9 runs,

            •           Sahan claimed 1 wicket for 12 runs, and

            •           Rifky picked up 1 wicket for 14 runs.

In reply, the Present Boys successfully chased the target, reaching 118 runs for 7 wickets in 19.2 overs, winning the match by 3 wickets.

            •           Lahiru played a crucial inning of 42 runs (38 balls),

            •           Charith remained not out with 30 runs (30 balls), and

            •           Riwaky added 12 runs (11 balls).

For the Old Boys,

            •           Heshan took 2 wickets for 16 runs,

            •           Lilan claimed 2 wickets for 20 runs, and

            •           Namila picked up 2 wickets for 22 runs.

The match concluded in a friendly spirit, with both teams sharing moments of joy and togetherness. The event highlighted the strong sense of unity and sportsmanship among the University of Vavuniya community.

Result: Present Boys won by 3 wickets

# Chess Tournament for the 4th Anniversary of the University of Vavuniya

October 2, 2025

The Physical Education Unit of the University of Vavuniya organized a Chess Tournament on **02 October 2025** to celebrate the **4th Anniversary** of the university. The event was held at the **University of Vavuniya premises in Pambaimadu**.

The **Vice Chancellor, Prof. A. Atputharajah**, served as the **Chief Guest**, while **Mr. S. A. Jude Leon**, Chairman of the Sports Advisory Board, was the **Guest of Honor**. The ceremony began with the **lighting of the oil lamp** by the guests, arbiters, and students, followed by a **welcome speech** delivered by **Mr. R. Sivasegaran**.

The tournament matches commenced at 8:30 AM. More than 250 students participated in the event, competing in the following categories:

- Under-07 (Boys and Girls)
- Under-09 (Boys and Girls)
- Under-11 (Boys and Girls)
- Under-13 (Boys and Girls)
- Under-15 (Boys and Girls)

At the end of the program, the **Physical Education Unit distributed participation certificates** to all attendees. The **Vice Chancellor and Chairman of the Sports Advisory Board awarded trophies** to the winners who secured **1st, 2nd, and 3rd places** in each category. The program concluded with a **vote of thanks delivered by the Instructress of Physical Education-Ms.G.Thusyanthy**, expressing gratitude to all participants, guests, and organizers for making the event a success.

# Workshop on Introducing Innovation Ideas and Commercializing the Inventions amoung Students

December 17, 2025

![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/image-7-1024x389.png)

The workshop on introducing innovative ideas and commercialising the inventions among students was held on March 02, 2022, from 12.30 to 4.30 PM at the IT Centre, University of Vavuniya.  This workshop was jointly organised by the Sri Lanka Inventors Commission (SLIC) and the University Business Linkage Cell of the University of Vavuniya through the Young Inventors’ club of the University of Vavuniya. Around 100 students participated in the workshop physically, representing the Faculty of Applied Science, Faculty of Business Studies, and Faculty of Technological Studies. Also, some students were taking part in the workshop online. The resource people from SLIC discussed the topics of introduction to SLIC and SLIC’s duties. What are inventions and innovations? Comparisons of Inventions, National and international, pathways to the Inventors and Market Needs and How to Commercialise Inventions.

![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/image-9.png)

![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/image-8.png)

# Vavuniya University Opens New Library: PM Stresses Quality Education & Research

August 2, 2025

On the morning of 2nd August 2025, at approximately 9:30 AM, Her Excellency Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, the Honourable Prime Minister of Sri Lanka and Minister of Education, Higher Education, and Vocational Education, ceremoniously inaugurated the new University Library at Vavuniya. She unveiled the commemorative plaque and toured the newly established facility, marking a significant milestone in the region’s academic development.

Following the inauguration, the Prime Minister engaged in a comprehensive discussion with members of the university community, including the Chancellor, former Professor Dr. S. Moahanthas, the Vice-Chancellor, Senior Professor A. Atputharajah, the Registrar and Bursar, Deans of Faculties, Heads of Departments, academic staff, executives, non-academic staff, and student representatives. Additionally, several key figures from the Vavuniya district participated in the meeting, including university council members, the government agent of Vavuniya District, forest officials, health professionals such as the PDHS, Deputy RDHS, and Director of the District General Hospital, consultants, and other senior officials.

The dialogue covered a wide range of issues concerning the current state of the university and the surrounding region. The Prime Minister listened to requests and concerns raised by staff and students, particularly regarding the increase in human resources, addition of new faculties, and improvement of shared facilities such as cafeterias, study spaces, advisory centres, and recreational areas. She strongly emphasised the government’s commitment to eliminating ragging and any form of campus violence, while also affirming that peaceful student activism and constructive engagement would always be respected.

Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya emphasised the need to shift the focus of universities beyond merely producing first-degree graduates, advocating instead for a transformation towards postgraduate research and advanced learning that empowers students to engage with the wider world meaningfully. She also recognised the challenges posed by systemic gaps in school education, noting that universities are increasingly burdened with addressing foundational skill deficits in first-year students. As part of her broader vision, she spoke of evolving the University of Vavuniya into a hub for teacher education, cutting-edge research, and internationally recognised postgraduate programmes.

The meeting concluded on a hopeful and appreciative note as attendees welcomed the Prime Minister’s clear commitment to strengthening the University of Vavuniya not only through infrastructure like the new library but also by fostering academic excellence, inclusivity, and student-centred development. The day’s events reaffirmed the growing role of the University of Vavuniya as a key contributor to the educational and socio-economic progress of the Northern region.

# Milk Boiling Ceremony – New Library Building

January 18, 2023

# Discussion on Industry-Oriented Development and Student Empowerment Held at University of Vavuniya

July 28, 2025

A team led by Mr. Raj Rajaratnam visited the University of Vavuniya and conducted a detailed discussion on industrial development-orientated projects on July 28, 2025. The delegation was led by Ms. Sonnali Weerakody, Managing Director of Synamon Global Pvt. Ltd, accompanied by her team. The discussion focused on advancing educational initiatives, optimising operations, and exploring opportunities for collaborative growth. Key areas included student empowerment, industry engagement, entrepreneurial exposure, global internship opportunities, and infrastructure development.

# Ministry of Science and Technology Delegation Visits University of Vavuniya for Proposed Incubation Center on Sustainable Food Innovation

July 11, 2025

A delegation from the Ministry of Science and Technology, led by Mr. Y. I. M. Navavi, Secretary to the Ministry, visited the University of Vavuniya on 11th July 2025 to conduct a site inspection for the proposed Incubation Centre for Sustainable Food Innovation. The delegation included Ms. Kumari Meegahakotuwa (Director General – Planning), Dr. Uthapala Alahakoon (Director – Development), Mr. Manoj Karunarathne (Director – Vidatha), Mr. M. Jeyasarma Goonarathne (Deputy Director – Vidatha), Ms. S. K. S. Aravinhi (Assistant Director – Vidatha), Ms. Lathika Dilrukhshi (District Vidatha Officer – Ministry), Mr. Sugath Jeyavi Premalal (Personal Assistant to the Hon. Minister), and Mr. Thabendran (Vidatha Officer – District Secretariat Office, Vavuniya). The Ministry has launched this initiative as a pilot project in 2025, and the University of Vavuniya has been selected as a partner institution to establish the incubation centre for food innovation. The primary objective of the project is to support regional inventors and entrepreneurs by providing access to product testing, advanced technology, specialized equipment, and value-added services, thereby fostering innovation and sustainable food solutions in the region.

# Visit of Prof. Ganesh Rajah to the University of Vavuniya

January 17, 2025

Prof. Ganesh Rajah, professor and executive director of the Center for Executives and Professional Development, London, UK, and advisory board member of the University Business Linkages (UBL), visited the University of Vavuniya from January 17th to 26th, 2025. During his visit, Prof. Rajah supported UBL development activities and provided valuable documentation and consultation.

His visit included visits to various institutions, including District Secretariats, and the Vanni regions (Mullaitivu, Vavuniya, and Mannar). Prof. Rajah conducted several consultation sessions on entrepreneurship and economic development with key organizations such as IDB, SED, NEDA, NPS, NCC, EDB, NDC, and the the Ministry of Science and Technology.

In addition, Prof. Rajah engaged in discussions with the Governor of the Northern Province regarding the SME sector, industrial development, and the limitations hindering progress in these areas. He also visited several startup companies in the Vanni Region, accompanied by the Vice Chancellor, Director of UBL, and the ESBM Coordinator of the University of Vavuniya.

# Advanced Workshop on Idea Generation and Business Development for Entrepreneurs.

November 23, 2024

![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/image-10-1024x665.png)

The University Business Linkage Cell, University of Vavuniya, in collaboration with the GATE Institute, UK, jointly organised an “Advanced Workshop on Idea Generation and Business Development for Entrepreneurs” in the university premises, Pampaimadu, Vavuniya, on the 23rd of November 2024, from 9.00 am to 4.00 pm. This workshop is designed for established entrepreneurs, early-stage entrepreneurs, students with business ideas, and aspiring entrepreneurs to empower entrepreneurs, honour business ideas, foster the creation of new products, and accelerate growth. Nearly 170 participants attended the event, which began with registration and the lighting of the traditional lamp. Distinguished guests, including Dr. M. Arumukam (Chairman of the Startup Committee & Foundation, Member of the TANSAM Centre of Excellence, Tamil Nadu, India), Mr. P. Parthipan (Vice President, Device Programs at Peloton Interactive, California, USA & Co-Founder and Managing Partner, Tamil Ventures LP.), and Mr. M. Thabenthiran (District Vidatha Officer, District Secretariat, Vavuniya and Mullaitivu), attended as special guests. The Chief Guest, Sevithi Sai Murali, the Consul General of India in Jaffna, also graced the occasion.

Nearly 175 participants participated in this workshop. The event began with the registration of participants, and traditional customs were honoured with the lighting of the traditional lamp.

Then the official event commenced with a welcome address by Ms. S. Mathivathany, Director of the Business Linkage Cell, followed by an introductory speech by Dr. S. Senthan, CEO of the GATE Institute, UK. Mr. K. Jeyaraj introduced the “GATE for Innovation, Venture & Entrepreneurship” programme, while Prof. Y. Nanthagopan, Dean of the Faculty of Business Studies, delivered a key speech on the importance of innovation and entrepreneurship in economic growth. Mr. P. Sasitharan, Programme Coordinator for Entrepreneurship and Business Management at the University of Vavuniya, spoke on the “Power of a Business Plan for an Entrepreneur”. Prof. A. Atputharajah, Vice Chancellor of the University of Vavuniya, also delivered a speech on the importance of digital innovation for entrepreneurship development. The session on “Entrepreneurship and Innovation” was delivered by Dr. M. Arumukam, while Mr. Parthipan Paramsothy led a session on “Lessons from Global Perspectives”.

The workshop fostered a deeper understanding of the local and global entrepreneurial landscape, helping participants identify new market opportunities, trends, and challenges. The final registration of entrepreneurs into the GIVE platform was another key benefit, as it provided ongoing support and resources for participants to scale their businesses. Overall, the workshop empowered participants to refine their business ideas, expand their networks, and accelerate the growth of their entrepreneurial ventures.

Participants gained valuable insights into local and global entrepreneurial landscapes, helping them identify market opportunities, trends, and challenges. Through expert sessions, participants were empowered to refine their business ideas and learn practical strategies for creating innovative products and services. Also, the event fostered connections among entrepreneurs, students, and industry experts, laying the groundwork for collaborations and mentorship opportunities. Entrepreneurs were registered on the GIVE platform, which will provide ongoing support, mentorship, and resources for business growth.

It successfully empowered entrepreneurs, honoured innovative ideas, and accelerated entrepreneurial growth through a comprehensive agenda of interactive sessions, expert guidance, and networking opportunities. This initiative highlights the collaborative efforts of the University Business Linkage Cell and the GATE Institute in advancing entrepreneurship, not just locally but with a global outlook, fostering the economic and innovative growth of the region.

# Workshop on “Ethics and Values for Teaching Professionals and Administrators: Ethics Model of Excellence Framework”

December 18, 2025

The Globethics South Asia Centre, Bangalore, in collaboration with the Staff Development Centre and the Centre for International Affairs of the University of Vavuniya, conducted a two-day Faculty Development Programme (FDP) titled “Ethics and Values for Teaching Professionals and Administrators: Ethics Model of Excellence Framework”, held at the Project Management Hall (PMH 1) on 14th and 15th November 2025 from 9.00 a.m. to 4.00 p.m.

The programme featured esteemed resource persons including Prof. V. Rajula, South Asia Regional Manager, Globethics, Bangalore; Dr. K. Shailaja Rao, FDP Facilitator, Aditya University, Andhra Pradesh; and Dr. S. Senthilnathan, Programme Director, UGC–Malaviya Mission Teacher Training Centre and Professor of Educational Technology, Bharathidasan University, Tamil Nadu. This workshop Designed to empower faculty members to integrate ethics into teaching, research, administration, and policy engagement, the FDP aimed to promote transformative ethical leadership and uphold high ethical standards within the academic community.

Day 1 commenced with an inauguration and introductory remarks by Mr. G.R.M. Gamlath Director, Staff development Centre  followed by addresses from Dr. K. Kalainathan Director

Centre for International Affairs addressed the gathering and highlighted the relevance of ethics in higher education and Senior Prof. A. Atputharajah Vice chancellor, University of Vavuniya   delivered the Special Address, emphasizing the need for ethical conduct and professionalism in academia..

The morning session was conducted by Dr. Shailaja Rao and Prof. V. Rajula on the topic “Understanding the Ethical Purpose of Educational Excellence vs Institutional Excellence.” In this session, the facilitators clearly explained the basic ideas of ethics in higher education and why ethics is important for teachers and administrators. Participants learned about different ethical foundations and ethical dimensions, and how these influence daily decisions in teaching and administrative work. The facilitators explained how ethical alignment—matching personal values with institutional values—helps create a trustworthy and responsible academic environment. They also highlighted the role of leadership, showing how leaders should guide others by practicing honesty, fairness, and responsibility. The session ended with examples of global best practices, showing how universities around the world use ethical frameworks to improve their reputation and academic standards.

The second session continued with a practical focus on “Building high-performing ethical teams in higher education”. Participants learned the features of an ethical team, such as good communication, shared values, responsibility, and teamwork. The facilitators explained how to set ethical goals and how proper delegation can support ethical behaviour in the workplace. They also discussed common challenges faced by teams, such as misunderstandings, conflict, or pressure, and offered solutions to overcome these issues. Real-life examples were used to help participants understand how ethics can guide daily work in departments and administrative units.

Day 2 Dr. S. Senthilnathan Programme Director, UGC- Malaviya Mission Teacher Training Centre and Professor, Department of Educational Technology, Bharathidasan university Tiruchirappalli, Tamil Nadu, India conducted the session on the Model Code of Educator Ethics, followed by an activity-based exploration of the PERMA Profiler, and concluded with a discussion on issues, challenges, and ethical dilemmas in higher education.

The evening session was conducted by Dr. Shailaja Rao on the topic “Navigating Ethical Dilemmas in Higher Education.” In this session, participants learned that ethical dilemmas in universities act like mirrors—they show who we are and what values we uphold. Dr. Rao explained that countries like India and Sri Lanka, with their long and rich educational history from Nalanda to Anuradhapura, should set an example by promoting integrity, fairness, and accountability in higher education. She reminded the participants that the true greatness of a university is not measured only by its buildings or rankings, but by the ethical strength and character of its people.

The programme ended with participant reflections and concluding remarks, highlighting the effectiveness of the workshop in strengthening ethical awareness and leadership among the academic community.

# Colors Night 2024

December 22, 2025

The Colors Night of the University of Vavuniya was successfully held on 12 December 2025 at the Smart Lecture Hall, Faculty of Applied Science, from 4.00 p.m. to 6.00 p.m. in a grand and vibrant atmosphere.

The event was graced by Dr. M. Kayanan, Dean of the Faculty of Applied Science and former Chairman of the Sports Advisory Board, who attended as the Special Guest and added great prestige to the occasion.

The ceremony was further honoured by the presence of Mr. Ramramanan, Bursar of the University; Ms. Yasodha Ramramanan, Student Counsellor; Ms. Akkila, Lecturer of the Faculty of Business Studies; Mr. Suman, Marshal; and Mr. Lesly, Karate Coach. The programme commenced with the Welcome Speech delivered by the Acting Director of the Physical Education Unit.

The participation of these distinguished guests greatly contributed to the success of the event and provided encouragement to the students and athletes. The University of Vavuniya, which secured places at the Inter-University Games 2024 and performed well in their sporting activities, awarded Colors and Half-Colors to deserving athletes.

During the ceremony, the University Table Tennis Team introduced the Table Tennis Memorial Trophy – (Hiruna Dilshan Jayawardena).

Colors Night served as a meaningful platform to recognize and appreciate the dedication, talent, and achievements of student sportsmen and sportswomen, making the evening both memorable and inspiring.

# 3rd Jaffna International Chess Championship

December 19, 2025

The **3rd Jaffna International Chess Championship** is scheduled to be held from **3rd to 7th December 2025** at **Chelva Palace, Kokuvil, Jaffna, Sri Lanka**. This prestigious event will bring together chess players from across the country and beyond, offering a platform for competitive play, cultural exchange, and the promotion of chess in the Northern Province of Sri Lanka.

The championship is part of the broader **Jaffna International Chess Festival**, which has become a significant annual event in the Sri Lankan chess calendar. It not only highlights the growing popularity of chess in the region but also provides opportunities for young and emerging players to showcase their talent on an international stage.

In recognition of outstanding performance, Our **University of Vavuniya chess team** achieved remarkable success by securing the **1st Runner-up position** in the **Best Higher Education Sector category** at the festival. This accomplishment reflects the team’s dedication, skill, and commitment to excellence, while also bringing pride to their institution and inspiring other universities to strengthen their chess programs.

# Training Program on the Concept of Harmony & Reconciliation 22&23/01/2022

December 17, 2025

![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/r1.jpg)

**Training Program on the Concept of Harmony & Reconciliation 22&23/01/2022**

A training program for the Management Committee members was organised by the Institute of National Security Studies and the Harmony Centre. It was held on January 22 and 23, 2022, from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. in the Institute’s conference room at the Institute of National Security Studies (INSS), 8th Floor, Suhurupaya, Battaramulla, Sri Lanka, with the goal of giving participants the chance to experience and learn about Harmony practices and to gain knowledge.

The Institute of National Security Studies’ Director, Professor Rohan Gunaratna, was instrumental in setting up the training programme. This programme included thirteen (13) participants, comprising nine (09) students from all three faculties and four (04) faculty members.

![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/1.1.png)![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/1.0-300x300-1-150x150.jpg)![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/1.2-300x300-1-150x150.jpg)![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/1.3.png)![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/2-1.jpg)

**Future Ready Youth Leadership – Residential Training**

With the assistance of the Ministry of Youth and Sports, the National Centre for Leadership Development (NCLD), Yodagama, Empilipitiya, and the Harmony Centre/University of Vavuniya sponsored a five-day residential training program for future-ready youth leaders. There were 149 participants overall from the University of Vavuniya, with students from every field and from every ethnic and religious background. This residential training includes a variety of programmes, such as group activities, physical activities, and multiple objectives for the students to complete, addressing leadership, a meditation programme, physical fitness activities, in- and outbound training, and personal development.

The training programme began with an inauguration ceremony and a welcoming address by Mr. A.B.M. Ashraf, director of NCLD. The principal guests were Prof. T. Mangaleshwaran, Vice Chancellor, University of Vavuniya; Mr. Anuratha Vijayakone, Secretary, Ministry of Youth and Sports; Prof. Premakumara de Silva, Chairman of the Standing Committee on SRC, University Grants Commission, and social reconciliation; and Prof. Shanthi Nandhana Wijesinghe, Chairperson, Training, Education and Research Committee, Harmony Centre, University of Vavuniya. Then, the distinguished principal guests spoke about how young people can help improve the country and continued the day’s programmes with personal, regional and national development training programmes.

![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/2.2-300x300-1.jpg)

![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/2.3-300x300-1.jpg)

![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/2.4-300x300-1.jpg)

![](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/2.1-300x300-2.jpg)

# Commencement of Work – 2026

January 1, 2026

The University of Vavuniya ceremonially commenced duties of the New Year on the 1st of January 2026 with a special function attended by Professor A. Atputharajah, the Vice-Chancellor, along with Deans of Faculties, Registrar, Bursar and all other staff members of the University. The function commenced with the hoisting of the national and university flags by the vice chancellor and registrar, followed by the singing of the national anthem. Subsequently, the Public Servants’ Oath was read by the Registrar, which was followed by the staff of the university.

## Support Centre for Persons with Disabilities

### About the Centre

The Support Centre for Persons with Disabilities was established to provide various services such as human helpers, access to physical resources, etc., to carry out smooth academic activities by the staff and undergraduates with disability. Hence, it hoped to protect and promote the rights of education of undergraduates with disability through the established centre.

It established a special service centre in the name of ‘Support Centre for Persons with Disabilities’ (SCPD) in March 2022.

This will benefit not only the staff and the students of the university but also the community in the region. Now the established centre has been providing its special services to staff and students with disability and would like to expand its services towards other community members with disability in the region.

Please visit our geographical map on this website to find the location of the centre.

## Key Interventions

Completed

- Formation and function of the SCPD committee
- Physical establishment of SCPD
- Survey on persons with disabilities.
- Initiating short-term courses on disability by the university.

On Going

- Organising awareness workshops for the staff and students.
- Development and implementation of 3% disability inclusion in employment                              opportunities inthe university.
- Development of networks with national and international universities, other higher                 education institutions, and donors.
- Disability inclusion in university sports activities.
- Encouragement for disability inclusion in all faculties.

## Goal & Objective

Goal

The overall goal of this centre is to protect and promote the educational rights of students with disability and the working rights of the staff with disability by providing them barrier free university society.

Objective

Operate well well-equipped special services centre for staff, students, and community members with disability. Run such an established centre successfully along with university’s day to day operation.

## Capital Works & Planning Unit

### About Us

The **Capital Works & Planning Unit** of the University of Vavuniya plays a vital role in the strategic development and infrastructure growth of the University. The Unit is responsible for planning, designing, and monitoring capital projects to ensure that the University’s physical environment supports its academic, research, and administrative needs.

Our primary focus is to develop a sustainable, functional, and modern university that reflects the University’s vision of becoming a centre of excellence in higher education. We work in close collaboration with university authorities, government agencies, and professional consultants to deliver projects that enhance teaching, learning, research, and student life.

#### Mr.M.Nanthakumar

Deputy Registrar

Capital Works & Planning

T.P: 024 2223911

## Objective

Planning & Implementation

Overseeing capital development projects from concept to completion.

Design & Maintenance

Designing and maintaining campus infrastructure and facilities.

Compliance

Ensuring all works meet national construction and safety standards.

Project Proposals

Equip students with skills to resolve personal, academic, and social conflicts effectively

Coordination

Working with stakeholders to ensure smooth and timely execution of projects.

Strategic Support

Contributing to the university’s long-term master plan and development strategies.

## Maintenance Unit

### About the Unit

The Maintenance Division is responsible for developing and maintaining lands, buildings, and other university infrastructure facilities to ensure smooth functioning and the achievement of the University of Vavuniya’s academic and administrative goals.

![Picture of Eng G. Thanushan  ](https://www.vau.ac.lk/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/G.Thanushan-233x300-1.jpg)

#### Eng G. Thanushan

Engineer / Maintenance Unit

## Key Functionalities

- Monitoring and certifying for payment of the ongoing Capital works
- Designing, estimating, executing, quality controlling and certifying for payment of the Rehabilitation works
- Planning the infrastructure developments according to the proposed masterplan
- Repairing and maintaining utility services such as electricity, water and sewerage systems, etc.
- Repairing and maintaining the buildings, roads and other infrastructure facilities
- Repairing and maintaining fixed assets such as furniture, plants, tools and machinery, etc.
- Carrying out preventive maintenance and breakdown maintenance works
- Landscaping works

## Establishments Branch

### About the Branch

At the University of Vavuniya Establishment Branch, our primary goal is to empower each staff member to achieve their personal and professional aspirations, thereby advancing the university’s mission, vision, and strategic objectives.

Supporting the university’s human resource needs and enhancing organizational vitality, the Establishments Branch administers a comprehensive range of functions with exceptional efficiency.

## Key Functionalities

Maintaining Cadre Details

Maintaining records of approved cadres, new cadre proposals, change of cadres and university cadre planning.

Maintaining of Personal Records

Development and maintenance of personal files of all Staff, upkeep the annual leave records of all staff.

Recruitment and Employee

Supports the University in administering the recruitments, appointments, confirmations, promotions, grant of increments, accepting resignations, terminations, etc.

Performance Evaluation

Handles the performance appraisal of all staff members of the university and process the payment of salary and annual increments.

Benefits Programs

Administer University Health Insurance Scheme, making these programs available to employees and assisting employees claims and obtaining beneficiary coverage. Process the release of UPF, release of pension and release of gratuity payments.

Training and Development

Assisting to obtain scholarships and to follow staff development programs organized by the MOHE/UGC/ERD/other Universities to all staff members by circulating relevant circulars & information. Accepting and forwarding applications.

Compliance with State and Commission Regulations

Ensure the university comply with UGC Act/ Commission and Public Administration Circulars/ Procedures/ Letters/ instructions.

Statutory Bodies

Handle matters to council / Leave and Awards committee / Management committee and placing memos on staff matters and implement decisions and take follow-up actions.

Statistical Information

Updating/ Providing information to the University Grants Commission/ Government Departments.

Disciplinary Matters of Employees

Trade Union Matters

Any Other Matters Assigned Related to the Employees

## Academic Affairs & Publication Branch

### About the Branch

The Academic Affairs & Publication Branch comes under the overall supervision of the Registrar. It is responsible for handling all matters related to academic matters in the university and publications of the academic establishment, collection of data and compilation of University statistics, convening meetings and handling Research Activities.

## Administration Branch

### About the Branch

The General Administration Branch plays a crucial role in ensuring the seamless operation of the University by providing essential services related to personnel, facilities, and overall management. This branch is responsible for overseeing administrative functions that support the diverse needs of students, faculty, and staff, fostering an environment conducive to learning, teaching, and professional work. The General Administration Branch ensures that all academic and non-academic activities run efficiently by managing human resources, infrastructure, and institutional policies. Its services include coordinating office operations, maintaining university buildings and grounds, implementing institutional guidelines, and facilitating various logistical and operational requirements. This branch contributes to the overall effectiveness and sustainability of the University’s mission and goals through its efforts.

## Registrar’s office

### About Us

The registrar of a university shall be appointed by the council upon the recommendation of a selection committee, the composition of which shall be prescribed by ordinance. The first registrar of a university shall be appointed by the University Grants Commission in terms of section 144 of the Universities Act No. 16 of 1978 as amended. Registrar shall be a full-time officer of the University and shall exercise, perform and discharge powers, duties

The Registrar’s office manages the activities and maintains the records of the governing Council and the Senate of the University. Moreover, this office administers the overall staff functions of non-academic staff and matters regarding the general administration of the university. The Registrar’s Office maintains the overall coordination of main university activities within the university with the University Grants Commission, the line ministry of higher education, and other relevant entities. Further, the office engages with many different correspondences, messages, and enquiries, etc., within and outside the university.

## Duties

1. The Registrar shall be responsible for the custody of the records and the property of the University.
2. The Registrar shall be the ex officio secretary of the Council and the Senate.
3. The Registrar shall be the Assistant Accounting Officer of the University.
4. The Registrar shall, subject to the direction and control of the Vice-Chancellor, be responsible for the general administration of the university and the disciplinary control of its non-academic staff.

## Landscape Division

### About us

The University of Vavuniya is situated in Pamapimadu, Vavuniya. The university owns one hundred and sixty (160) acres of land area with the forest pocket (25 acres) and two minor tanks (Saalampaikulam and Velan Kulam). Salampaikulam is situated between the university residential area and the academic area. It helps to maximise the biodiversity of flora and fauna and makes the premise environmentally friendly. The university premise consists of more than 2500 trees (65 species) except for the forest pocket. It helps to embrace nature, celebrate the seasons with its beauty, and involve the students and staff in their studies and hobbies (projects, photography, bird watching, etc.). Vavuniya is located in the dry zone area. We have summer/dry (Mar – Aug) and winter/rainy (Sept – Feb) seasons. June is the driest month, and December is the wettest month. Landscaping is a creative and deeply satisfying experience. It is important to add landscape features with the basic landscape principles. A garden or a land can be made more attractive by altering the existing design, adding ornamental features, and planting trees and shrubs. Indoor and outdoor landscape gardening helps to involve the staff and students in recreational activities. The Landscape and Green Environment committee is formed in order to plan, design, and develop the landscape and gardening activities with the proposed theme, “The Arboretum University” (the 1st ever arboretum university in Sri Lanka), and to develop the strategic and action plan for the proposed landscape activities in time phases. Currently, we propose new landscape activities to develop the masterplan with the inclusion of additional garden and landscape features. Staff, students, and visitors can visit and enjoy the gardening and landscape features. It helps to make the University of Vavuniya as a tourist spot to develop the tourism.

To be an iconic place among the universities of Sri Lanka and in Vavuniya in aesthetic and functional aspects

## Mission

To exceed the plant species to make the land greenery and environment friendly with the landscape designs, installation and maintenance

## Proposed landscape activities are

- Inclusion of ‘Unique plant’ concept to different areas
- Establishment of a herbal garden (for teaching, learning and research purposes)
- Establishment of a cacti & succulent plant house
- Establishment of a “Garden for Blinds” (1st ever garden for blinds in Sri Lanka)
- Establishment of a Nature Trail in the forest patch
- Building ‘iconic’ hard landscape features at 3-4 locations

## Program

**A. Tree Plantation Program**

Landscape Division conduct the tree plantation programs with the collaboration of Faculties, Societies (ENSOC, Dept. Bio. Sc.), Unions (Student), External Organizations (Department of Forest, Marutham Pasumai Movement, Green Layer Environmental Organization) and etc. In addition, as a remembrance, celebration, or retrospective, tree plantation is carried out by a person, group of people, or organisation through the donation program at the university premises.

Tree plantations are carried out by the Landscape Division individually based on the master plan with the maintenance.

**B. Workshop**

The Landscape Green Environment Committee (LGEC) draws the workshop or program in the strategic plan related to landscape and horticultural practices to achieve the targets and goal.

[Tree Plantation](https://www.vau.ac.lk/tree-plantation-2)

[Work Shop](https://www.vau.ac.lk/workshop)

[Plant sale Centre](https://www.vau.ac.lk/plant-sale-centre-uov)

## Tree Plantation

**Tree Plantation Event 01:**

By Faculty of Business Studies at the faculty areas (250 Saplings) on 09th December 2020

**Tree Plantation Event 02:**

By University Staffs at IT Center Area (50 Saplings) on 16th July 2021

**Tree Plantation Event 03:**

By Landscape Division at Faculty of Applied Science Areas (10 Saplings) on 10th August 2021

**Tree Plantation Event 04:**

By Marutham Pasumai Movement, Vavuniya at University Premises (500 Saplings) on 25th October 2021

**Tree Plantation Event 05:**

By Landscape & Green Environment Committee Members at Gate 2 Roadside(10 Saplings) on 10th March 2022

**Tree Plantation Event 06:**

By Faculty of Technological Studies at Gate 1 Roadside(75 Saplings) on 15th–22nd April 2022

**Tree Plantation Event 07:**

By Maintenance & Landscape Division at Male Hostel Area (50 Saplings) on May 2022

**Tree Plantation Event 08:**

By Green Layer Environmental Organization, Neervely at Faculty of Applied Science & Faculty of Technological Studies Areas (100 Saplings) on 07th June 2022

(Collaboration of Green layer environmental organization, Neervely (Plant Donor), ENSOC (FAS), Maintenance Unit and Landscape Division)

**Tree Plantation Event 09:**

By Landscape Division at Faculty of Applied Science, Faculty of Technological Studies Areas & Female Hostel Areas (100 Saplings) on 03rd October 2022

**Tree Plantation Event 10:**

By Landscape Division at Gate 02 Roadside(35 Saplings) on 10th October 2022

**Tree Plantation Event 11:**

By Council Members of the University of Vavuniya at IT Center Area (07 Saplings) on 28th December 2022

## Introduction

The plant sale centre establishment is initiated to serve both staff and students, and later to extend the services to the public as well.

## Objective

Encouraging sustainability and green practices, enhancing university beauty, boosting mental health through plant accessibility, providing educational resources and workshops on plant care and generating a modest revenue stream for the university.

## Benefits

- align with the university’s green campus goals
- Contributes to mental health improvements by enhancing air quality and reducing stress
- Provides hands-on learning opportunities for students and staff
- Fosters community building among those interested in gardening and sustainability

### Strategic Development Plan

A strategic and action plan for the development of the green infrastructure has been prepared with individual goals related to the landscape and horticultural gardening practices/management.

Goals of the strategic plan for the development of the green infrastructure for the University of Vavuniya

- **Goal-01**: Enhancing the green cover to make our land environmentally friendly with biodiversity
- **Goal-02**: Enhance the aesthetic and functional aspects of the university area
- **Goal-03**: Empowering the physical and human resources of the landscape division for proper landscape management
- **Goal-04**: Empowering the human resources to enhance the green environment
- **Goal-05**: Enhancing the knowledge dissemination of the landscaping and horticulture gardening activities
- **Goal-06**: Improving the landscape and gardening features and practices through the proper management/maintenance
- **Goal-07**: Increasing the income generation projects for the development of the landscaping and horticulture gardening

## Gallery

**A. Flora and Fauna**

The university owns one hundred and sixty (160) acres of land area with the forest pocket (25 acres) and two minor tanks (Saalampaikulam and Velan Kulam). Salampaikulam is situated between the university residential area and the academic area. It helps to maximise the biodiversity of flora and fauna and makes the premise environmentally friendly. The university premise consists of more than 2500 trees (65 species) except for the forest pocket. It helps to embrace nature, celebrate the seasons with its beauty, and involve the students and staff in their studies and hobbies (projects, photography, bird watching, etc.).

**B. Landscape and Gardening Activities**

Landscaping is a creative and deeply satisfying experience. It is important to add landscape features with the basic landscape principles. A garden or a land can be made more attractive by altering the existing design, adding ornamental features, and planting trees and shrubs. Indoor and outdoor landscape gardening helps to involve the staff and students in recreational activities.

**C. Donation**

The person, group of people, or organisation can donate the fund or goods for the development of the landscape and green environment of the University of Vavuniya.

## Landscape & Gardening Activities

Landscaping is a creative and deeply satisfying experience. It is important to add landscape features with the basic landscape principles. A garden or a land can be made more attractively by altering the existing design, adding ornamental features and planting trees and shrubs. Indoor and outdoor landscape gardening helps to involve the staffs and students in recreational activities.

## Finance Branch

### About the Branch

As the Chief Finance Officer of the University, the Bursar is responsible for developing and implementing a sound internal control system in line with financial management to provide timely financial information to internal and external stakeholders.

Financial management of the University is governed by the financial regulations, conveyed through circulars and circular letters and also by the directives that may from time to time be issued by the Treasury, Ministry of Higher Education, University Grants Commission and the Governing Council of the University.

The university funds, whether internally generated or received by way of Government grants, subsidies and loans, allocated from the Consolidated Fund through the Government Budget to meet Recurrent and Capital expenditure, are public funds. The management has a responsibility for the efficient utilization of public funds in the best interest of the public. Fund Management is dependent on how effectively revenue is generated and expenditure is controlled.

University of vavuniya is newly established with limited infrastructure facilities, we are still looking for Public Private Partnership to enhance our facilities to fulfill the requirement of our stakeholders.

## Finance Branch Functionalities

Preparation of Annual Financial Budget of the university.

The university prepares an annual budget that outlines expected income and expenditure.

Request funds from funding agencies and manage them.

he university requests financial support from government bodies, private organizations, and donors.

Received all monies paid into university.

The financial office collects payments such as tuition fees, grants, donations, and other income sources.

Provision of funds for day to day operations.

Funds are allocated for essential activities such as salaries, utilities, maintenance, and student services.

Make all payments with proper authorization.

Payments are processed only after obtaining necessary approvals from university authorities.

Maintain the financial information system.

A computerized financial system is used to record, monitor, and analyze all financial transactions.

Preparation and presentation of management information reports for decision making.

Financial reports are prepared for university administrators to assist in strategic decision-making.

Preparation and presentation of Annual Financial Statements.

The university compiles annual financial statements to summarize its financial performance.

Preparation of annual procurement plan and maintenance of store function.

The procurement plan outlines necessary purchases for the university, ensuring cost-effective buying.

Management of finance for recurrent and capital expenditure activities according to the annual financial budget.

Recurrent expenditure covers ongoing costs like salaries, utilities, and operational expenses.

Maintaining of records on investments of funds in banks.

The university invests surplus funds in bank accounts or fixed deposits to earn interest.

## Responsibilities

As the central internal assurance mechanism, the unit performs the following key functions:

Pre-Audit of Sensitive Transactions

Reviewing and certifying payments related to:

- Pensions and gratuities
- University Provident Fund (UPF) contributions
- Staff bonds and agreements
- Capital works and infrastructure-related expenditures

Operational and Financial Inspections

Conducting thorough inspections of the university’s financial and operational functions, and

reporting findings to ensure proper accountability.

Evaluation of Internal Controls

Assessing the effectiveness of internal control systems, with a focus on detecting and

preventing:

- Resource waste
- Idle capacity
- Extravagance and inefficiencies

On-the-Spot Investigations

Undertaking immediate investigations in areas where delays or irregularities in execution

are identified.

Special Investigations

Carrying out specific investigations as requested by the Vice-Chancellor or the University

Council.

Systematic Review of Functions and Procedures

Conducting both continuous and periodic audits of all departments, faculties, divisions, centres, units, and cells to assess procedural soundness and compliance.

Recommendations for Institutional Improvement

Providing constructive suggestions aimed at enhancing operational, administrative, and financial efficiency across the university.

Regulatory Guidance and Support

Advising all administrative and financial units on:

- Financial regulations
- Government administrative guidelines
- Circulars issued by the UGC and other regulatory bodies

Audit Query Management

Maintaining the Audit Query Register, coordinating responses to audit observations, and ensuring timely resolution of issues raised by internal and external audits.

Audit and Management Committee Coordination

Organizing meetings of the Audit and Management Committee, preparing documentation, presenting internal audit matters, and ensuring follow-up on committee decisions.

## Student Counselling

### About Us

Counselling supports any university student who needs mental and emotional health and well-being. The term ‘counselling’ may mean different things to different people. The Student Counselling Service offers support for all students of the University of Vavuniya, mostly in the form of short-term counselling.

The office offers many services to the benefit of the students.

Counselling to solve their problems related to psychological issues

1.  to academic issues
2.  to financial issues

There are counsellors (both male and female) available to meet the students who need support during the working days. All information is kept confidential. If necessary, telephone communication is allowed for fixing the appointment and for explaining the situation before a face-to-face interaction takes place. There is a senior student counsellor managing this service for the university overall. All three faculties have student counsellors.

## Objective

Support Academic Success

Assist students in overcoming academic challenges, improving study habits, and managing time effectively to achieve their academic goals.

Promote Emotional and Mental Well-being

Provide a supportive environment for students to discuss their feelings, manage stress, anxiety, and other mental health issues, and develop healthy coping strategies.

Encourage Self-awareness and Personal Growth

Help students understand their strengths, weaknesses, interests, and values, fostering personal development and confidence.

Facilitate Problem-Solving and Conflict Resolution

Equip students with skills to resolve personal, academic, and social conflicts effectively

Guide Career and Educational Planning

Assist students in making informed decisions about future educational and vocational paths, including career exploration and college applications

Develop Interpersonal and Communication Skills

Enhance students’ abilities to communicate effectively and build positive relationships with peers, teachers, and the community

Foster a Positive University Environment

Help students adapt to the university setting, understand university regulations, and participate actively in the academic community

Promote Goal-setting and Motivation

Encourage students to set realistic goals and motivate them to pursue their aspirations with resilience

Organize Preventive and Awareness Programs

Implement programs to prevent academic failure, withdrawal, and other issues, and raise awareness about counselling services

Conduct Research and Feedback

Gather data on student needs and counselling outcomes to continuously improve services and inform stakeholders
